title: Liberation unable to create YAML-defined BF-109 squadron at Carpiquet unless there is premade squadron available
body:
### Affected versions

Development build

### Build information

DCS Liberation 7.0.0
Build 4777
Git revision 8150176fc62d7ead6faab45a615e522b5afd87fd

### Description

This one has rather stumped me, and I don't know what is causing it. I have 2 BF-109 squadrons in a campaign I am building. While the one that Brucheville gives me no problems, the one at Carpiquet consistently gets converted into an FW-190 Anton squadron UNLESS I add a second premade BF-109 squadron yaml, at which point it will work. However, if I only have a single premade BF-109 squadron, the BF-109 squadron at Carpiquet always gets generated as a FW-190 squadron.

This might potentially be related to the "u" with umlaut in the BF-109's name, which has caused it to be referred to in different ways in different files. It is possible that this is an unrelated problem however, but I am mentioning it here as a potential cause. I suspect the lone premade squadron always gets assigned to Brucheville as it has a lower ID number (5 vs 19)

Examples of differing names:
Squadron yaml for Jagdgeschwader 53: "Bf 109 K-4 Kurfürst"
In the Bf-109K-4.yaml under resources\units\aircraft\" "Bf 109 K-4 Kurf\xFCrst"
In the yaml for Khopa's Caen to Evreux campaign: "Bf 109 K-4 Kurf\u00fcrst"

I have tried all three variants, but none of them allowed me to create a randomly generated BF-109 squadron at Carpiquet.

### Save game and other files

[final_countdown_2.zip](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/11239171/final_countdown_2.zip)

title: WW2 fighters with premade squadrons have a smaller default mission set than randomly generated squadrons
body:
### Affected versions

Development build

### Build information

DCS Liberation 7.0.0
Build 4777
Git revision 8150176fc62d7ead6faab45a615e522b5afd87fd

### Description

WW2 fighters with premade squadrons are restricted to the following mission types in their squadron YAML.
  - CAS
  - Escort
  - Intercept
  - OCA/Aircraft
  - Fighter sweep
  - BARCAP
  - TARCAP

However, randomly generated squadrons have a larger set of mission types available as by default they can also perform
  - Strike
  - DEAD
  - BAI
  - OCA/Runway

As an example of this problem, here is a campaign with 2 Dora-9 squadrons. However, Liberation comes with only one premade Dora-9 squadron, so one of the 2 squadrons will be randomly generated.

![Screenshot 2023-04-15 203704](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/72491792/232208927-0b8ad8c8-3b44-4dc5-898d-3d34aef79407.jpg)

### Save game and other files

I am attaching a zip file containing the files of the campaign I am currently working on (.miz and .yaml, and the faction file), where I first noticed the problem.

title: Aircraft spawning at specific parking slots in cold start actually start in flight and crash.
body:
### Affected versions

6.1.1

### Build information

Doesn't matter what build. tested on local dev with multiple versions

### Description

Looking at the aircraft generation, for example in the following mission. We can see that the flankers at aleppo have took the parking slot "H01" and "H02" with the supposed takeoff from ramp. Upon careful inspection, the aircraft are actually spawned in air in a "turning point" waypoint type. this causes them to crash immediately at mission start.
A symptom that can also happen is that the aircraft are spawned above the runway in a single point. causing all of them to spawn and combust.

My theory is that in syria, falklands, persian gulf and nevada there are "Heli parking slots". planes spawned there automatically turn into turning point and thus the issue is created.

I am not sure if the fix should be in pydcs or somewhere else, but this causes the enemy AI to always die above a certain aircraft count in aleppo.

Could also be fixed by regarding the `airplanes` parameter in the parking slot object.

### Save game and other files

[liberation_nextturn_miz.zip](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/11200943/liberation_nextturn_miz.zip)

title: F-14 and F/A-18 flights carrying TALDs will overfly target site and die

labels.name: needs-changelog
labels.description: For PRs/bugs that were merged without being added to the changelog.

body:
### Affected versions

Development build

### Build information

DCS Liberation 7.0.0
Build 4775
Git revision 5c72e0754a438af1ea1cb1643528da7ce1df4b42

### Description

F-14 and F/A-18 flights carrying TALDs will not RTB after releasing their TALDs but instead overfly their target and most likely get shot down.

The reason for this is because they are relying on the waypoint command "RTB on out of ammo= .ASM" to turn around, but now that TALDs have been moved into their own category (Decoy), this flag does not get tripped when TALDs are depleted. Hornets carrying HARMs work just fine, so this is specifically a TALD problem.

To demonstrate this, I have setup a mission with three flights. One (named HARM) is just a standard SEAD flight with HARMS, to demonstrate that they are indeed RTBing after launching their HARMs as expected.

The second flight (named TALD) is one carrying TALDs. I have modified the weapon release type to Decoy so they will actually drop their TALDs (modified .miz attached below). This flight will not RTB after dropping its TALDs, continuing on to overfly the target.

The third flight (named NOA2A) is a flight modified to carry no A2A missiles, weapon release type changed to Decoy, and with "RTB on out of ammo= .ASM" changed to "RTB on out of ammo= all" (because it will not trigger if set to .ASM since TALDs are now in their own category, I tested this to make sure). This flight will launch its TALDs and RTB.

I have also tried setting  "RTB on out of ammo" to "guided", "bombs", and "guided bombs", none of which worked with TALDs. Unfortunately, ED did not create a  "RTB on out of ammo= decoy" option when splitting TALDs into their own category.

### Save game and other files

Here is the Liberation save in case you want to make your own modifications for testing. Note that without the changes in the mission editor described above, this save will not replicate the problem and workarounds. It is easier to just use the .miz below for replication.
[TALD Test 4.liberation.zip](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/11188254/TALD.Test.4.liberation.zip)


This is the manually modified .miz file
[liberation_nextturn.zip](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/11188227/liberation_nextturn.zip)

title: TALD flights (both F14 and F/A-18) will not launch TALDs unless Release Weapon Type is manually changed to Decoy

labels.name: needs-changelog
labels.description: For PRs/bugs that were merged without being added to the changelog.

body:
### Affected versions

Development build

### Build information

DCS Liberation 7.0.0
Build 4775
Git revision 5c72e0754a438af1ea1cb1643528da7ce1df4b42

### Description

Unless the Attack Group commands under the Ingress waypoint have their weapon release type changed to Decoy, both F-14s and F/A-18s will not release TALDs.

For F-14s, the default is Guided (because they use SEAD for TALD flights). For F/A-18s, you can theoretically use either (I have tested that both work provided release type is manually changed to Decoy). This is a bigger problem for Hornets because with the F-14s, they only have one SEAD weapon, which is the TALD. The Hornet has HARMs, so you can't just set weapon release type to Decoy, meaning Hornet either needs its own mission type for TALDs, or the weapon release type needs to be set based on loadout (e.g. if it's set on Liberation SEAD and carrying HARMs, use the standard Auto release type, and it's set on Liberation CEAD and carrying TALDs, use the Decoy release type).

### Save game and other files

Note that if you want to use this save for testing, you will have to manually change the weapon release type for the DECOY and DECOYF14 flights to Decoy.
[TALD Test 3.liberation.zip](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/11187946/TALD.Test.3.liberation.zip)

I have already manually edited it in this .miz file:
[liberation_nextturn.zip](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/11187962/liberation_nextturn.zip)

There are four flights in total, 2 Hornet and 2 Tomcat flights. 2 are unedited (they will not launch TALDs) and 2 are edited (these will launch TALDs).

labels.name: needs-changelog
labels.description: For PRs/bugs that were merged without being added to the changelog.

body:
### Affected versions

Development build

### Build information

DCS Liberation 7.0.0
Build 4775
Git revision 5c72e0754a438af1ea1cb1643528da7ce1df4b42

### Description

When you plan a SEAD flight, weapon release type is set as guided (you can see this under the ingress waypoint in the mission editor). If you plan a DEAD flight, it's set as auto. However, if you plan a SEAD flight and then change your mind and recreate it as a DEAD flight (in the Waypoints tab under Edit Flight), weapon release type is not updated to auto and remains as guided. This might be a potential problem for AI DEAD aircraft that are using unguided weapons.

Here's a sample mission with 3 flights.

Two of them are named REALSEAD and REALDEAD. Those are unmodifed. There is a third flight called SEAD2DEAD, which was first planned as a SEAD flight and then recreated as a DEAD flight.

title: dcs_liberation should use S_EVENT_UNIT_LOST rather than S_EVENT_CRASH

labels.name: needs-changelog
labels.description: For PRs/bugs that were merged without being added to the changelog.

body:
### Affected versions

6.1.1

### Build information

DCS Liberation 6.1.1

### Description

As seen in the "question" thread, Liberation doesn't account for airplanes (and units?) that are seen as "killed" by DCS unless they are completely removed from the F10 map. 

The issue makes missions such as destroying aircraft on the ground meaningless. 

The solution is for dcs_liberation.lua to use use S_EVENT_UNIT_LOST rather than S_EVENT_CRASH to intercept killed units. 
Changing that parameter in line 145 of dcs_liberation.lua makes the campaign count killed units properly.

See this thread:
https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/discussions/2764#top


### Save game and other files

Not needed.

title: 88 Flak Kdo not generated; will not engage aircraft without Kdo
body:
### Affected versions

6.0.0

### Build information

6.0.0

### Description

The templates and scripts all indicate that the Kdo should be generating with Flak groups, however it is not. There are two scenarios where this happens:

1. Factions using any coalition other than "Third Reich" or "Combined Joint Task Forces Red" do not have access to the Kdo unit, thus user is unable to manually add it to the group.
2. Factions using the "Combined Joint Task Forces Red" are still not generating Kdo with flak groups. Manually adding the Kdo in the Mission Editor allows them to engage*.

Attaching Liberation save file, .miz file, and faction file.

*88s do not properly engage aircraft faster than 350KGS, making them unsuitable for Korean War/Early Cold War scenarios. KS-19 is the better option but I have another bug report open on those not being generated at all. It seems that flak for Early Cold War is a bit buggered at the moment.

title: KS-19 not generated in .miz output
body:
### Affected versions

6.0.0

### Build information

DCS Liberation 6.0.0

### Description

Using a modified North Korea 1950s faction replacing the WW2 flak with KS-19 (among other edits). 

Initially KS-19 would not generate because the file in the unit resources is notated "null," so I replaced "null" with { } to match other unit resources. 

KS-19 is now generating in the Liberation software, but in the output .miz file they are not generated. Checking all of the AAA groups, they consist of a single unit: the logistics vehicle.

If I replace the KS-19 with another unit like the 88s or S-60s, they generate as advertised in the .miz file.

Attaching faction file, Liberation save file, and exported .miz file.

Issue with my .yaml edits or issue with Liberation?

title: Crash at campaign victory
body:
### Affected versions

6.0.0

### Build information

DCS Liberation 6.1.0

### Description

Context : 
Dunkirk campaign, captured (in DCS) the last enemy base. Finished the DCS mission, then moved to process the results in Liberation and ... callstack : 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2106199/210929624-b3c4b8cf-32ef-45a9-a21b-8ac8e4a70b48.png)

Problem : 
In Game.initialize_turn, the call to set_bullseye() fails if there is no more airbase on either side (assertion failed in theater.closest_opposing_control_points). Unfortunately, that call happens *before* the check for win/loss conditions in game.initialize_turn 

Expected : 
A splashscreen or a message congratulating me for my skill and persistence in taking the last enemy airbase and winning the campaign ! :))) 


=> I guess you can move the bullseye call a few lines lower, after the win/loss check, that should do it

[liberation.log](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/10357346/liberation.log)

title: Aircraft at Airports or FOB prevent capture via the custom trigger zone
body:
### Affected versions

6.0.0

### Build information

_No response_

### Description

If there is an aircraft at the Airport of FOB then the custom trigger zone capture event will not work. The Built-in DCS Capture event seems to check only for ground units in the are and recognized the capture event. As we removed that built in function there were some issue reports on the Discord that the capture is not working any more (with only the custom trigger zone we already use for FOBs).
There was also an report from Snappy that a flipped Helo prevent the capture of an FOB.

What should be changed to prevent this:
- Check if the custom trigger zone can be adopted to only check for ground units / objects 
- Try to find out what dcs uses built in and reuse that as custom trigger zone

The current hotfix #2652 onyl re-adds the built-in dcs event to Airfields. So we currently have 2 checks for airfields but still the same issue for FOBs as we dont have the built-in function there.

### Save game and other files

[cacauasus_9.zip](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/10267955/cacauasus_9.zip) from User Report (Stilo) on Discord https://discord.com/channels/595702951800995872/595702953495625729/1053977755718537236

title: Frontlines on Channel Map extend into the water
body:
### Affected versions

Development build

### Build information

DCS Liberation 7.0.0
Build 4551
Git revision 3863b8ef4097a7c103834a529a5b6792a9b21913

### Description

This bug was first reported on Discord by Revi here: https://discord.com/channels/595702951800995872/595706079459934208/1046461341197664357

Since he hasn't filed it yet, I'll go ahead and do so as I've verified the bug exists.

I had a look at the channel_terrain.miz file in resources\tools\ and it looked fine to me AFAICT.

Map in Liberation

title: Manual state.json submission after DCS crash without needing file edit to flip flag
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

At the moment, it appears that users have to edit the state.json file to change "mission_ended": false to true before manually submitting if DCS crashes.


It would be a convenience if Liberation either disregards that flag for manual submissions or automatically flips it to true before processing the json data.

title: IADS Network error caused by dead groups
body:
### Affected versions

Development build

### Build information

_No response_

### Description

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6678803/202525230-bee0c7c5-607f-48c5-9ac3-8ca3ed9504e8.png)

Dead groups which are not static should not be added as skynet connection during the lua data generation. It should also be restricted to just add Connection Nodes and Power Sources as secondary node to  a Primary node as this is the original root cause of the issue: A campaign designer added an EWR as secondary node to a primary node. As this EWR is non-static it would have been added to the skynet lua data as well which caused the error.

So to fix this issue it will be 2 tasks:
- Prevent the error by skipping dead non-statics
- Restrict which groups can be added as secondary nodes.

### Save game and other files

not required

title: F14B ground crew communication malfunction
body:
### Affected versions

5.2.0

### Build information

- DCS version 2.8
- Liberation version 5.2
- Liberation campaign Northern Russia
- ground crew doesn´t respond if asked to turn on the ground power/connect air supply

### Description

Hi guys,

I came across a bug with F-14B playing the Northern Russia campaign. 

I was assign to take off from the Tbilisi-Lochni airport and begin the mission in a cold/dark F14B on the parking lot. I found out, that I can´t contact the ground crew and ask them to turn on the ground power and connect the air supply. I get no response from the crew, even if I´m a doing everything correctly and can hear my "pilot" asking them to connect the power/air. This happened after I updated to the DCS v. 2.8 (I generated the Liberation mission after the update, its not an old mission), it did work from the same airfield in the past missions before the update.

First I thought I´m having some issues with the Vaicom Pro, which broke after the DCS update, but after the community patch I can use Vaicom Pro now. I found out, that even asking for ground power/ air supply via comm menu doesn´t work, so its definitely something else causing the trouble. 

I tested my own missions made in mission editor and DCS training missions, but this bug doesn´t occur with them and ground crew responds correctly. I tried to run a new DCS Liberation campaign and mission from new campaign worked properly as well. 

So something is bugged with that particular "old" Liberation generated mission. Please give it a try and take a look into it someday. I enclose the liberation miz file and saved game.

Thx,

Goliathus

### Save game and other files

[liberation_nextturn.zip](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/9919464/liberation_nextturn.zip)

title: Add or removing waypoints in Liberation generates an error
body:
### Affected versions

Development build

### Build information

DCS Liberation 6.0.0
Build 4382
Git revision 41fb28ae80271191c3bc20f064faf28a9877ed0e

### Description

At the moment, attempts to add a waypoint to a flight produce this error.
![Screenshot 2022-10-30 072327](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/72491792/198852145-de3adccf-5d1f-4e4a-a9c3-5f41ed5bd186.jpg)

Attempts to delete a waypoint produce this error.
![Screenshot 2022-10-30 072357](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/72491792/198852169-c17682c1-9bb1-4c03-8ea0-3e194d5e1003.jpg)

This is a different error from the one that was fixed back in Mar 2022 https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/issues/2063

Suggestions:
1. Disable the ability to remove the autogenerated waypoints, and allow users to only delete waypoints they have manually added
2. Add any additional waypoint by default after the auto-generated target waypoints (so, between the target waypoints and Split), rather than at the end of the list.
3. Allow the re-ordering of user-added waypoints.

title: Possible minor bug - wrong ATC freq
body:
### Affected versions

5.2.0

### Development build

_No response_

### Description

Hey guys,

I was running the Syria - Operation Peace Spring campaign recently and I came across a possible minor bug.

After I captured the Damascus airbase I departed from this airport with my F/A-18C and I found out that I can´t reach the ATC via CH1 preset freqency on COMM2. This is because the mission generator generates wrong frequency 251.850 MHz (on the kneeboard as well), but the Damascus ATC is listening on frequency 252.650 MHz.

I´m not sure how the DCS Liberation mission generator works, I´m just a simple user of this great dynamic campaign generator, but I guess that the freq. of the Damascus ATC was different somewhere in the past, but now it should be updated to 252.650 MHz in the DCS Liberation files, so it could be generated correctly. Of course,  it is easy to overcome this "issue" by changing the preset frequency manually...

Please take a look at this issue somewhere in the future. I enclose screenshots of my kneeboard with wrong ATC frequency (as I said, I departed from the Damascus airport), screenshot from the mission editor, where there is stated wrong ATC frequency, and a picture of the F10 map with correct ATC frequency.

Thx,

Goliathus

What Went Wrong?
Whenever an A4-E Skyhawk is present in a mission (even just purchased idle on an airfield), once the "Take Off" button is selected, An unexpected Error Occurs and we are unable to fly that mission.

To Reproduce:
Load up Liberation 6.0.0-4215-preview

Select Caucasus Black Sea
Select Next

Enable A-4E Skyhawk (version 2.0.0) check box
Select Next
Select Next
Select Finish
Add a Squadron of A-4E Skyhawks to Sukhumi-Babushara (any airfield will do)
Select Accept Changes and Start Campaign
Purchase 1x A-4E
Begin Campaign
Select Take Off
Select Yes
Receive Error

title: Flights of non-flyable aircraft can be given player slots
body:
### Affected versions

Development build

### Development build

https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/actions/runs/2723309031

### Description

Note: This bug is present in both the dev build and in 5.2

This is a long-standing bug where flights of non-flyable aircraft can be given player slots. Doing so prevents mission generation. With the release of the Mirage F1 and its multiple variants (only one of which is currently flyable), I think this might be a good time to tackle the bug. Otherwise, we are going to get a bunch of folks asking why they can't fly their Mirage F1 (because they've given a player slot to a non-flyable variant).

### Save game and other files

[Non-flyable Aircraft with Player Slots Example #4151.zip](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/9173576/Non-flyable.Aircraft.with.Player.Slots.Example.4151.zip)

title: Push-based events overhaul
body:
### Affected versions

Development build

### Development build

_No response_

### Description

Opening this issue to keep better track of the overhaul, labeling it (performance) bug/UX because fixing this will improve the UX since the map will update faster, more towards what we're used to from v5.2. Consider this as the first phase, effectively being a clean-up of `eventstream.tsx` to eliminate get-requests that are sent from the front-end as much as possible:

- [x] Navmesh updates (#2254)
- [x] Unculled zones (#2264)
- [x] Threat zones (#2254)

title: Not all map features updating properly
body:
### Affected versions

Development build

### Development build

_No response_

### Description

I found that many functions on the map are not updating properly. Things like the `ThreatZones` and `NavMeshes` in the left menu only update once, after that it seems to be getting the same data over and over again. Options on right side like "Ships", "Factories", "Air defences", etc. seem to be FUBAR as well. Also supply routes were not being drawn in the correct color after a capture event. So yeah, I think I found a new issues to solve 🤣 

An overview:

- [x] ThreatZones not updating after first update
- [x] Navmeshes not updating after first update
- [x] SupplyRoutes not updating at all
- [x] Air defences: FUBAR
- [x] Factories: FUBAR
- [x] Ships : FUBAR
- [x] Other ground objects: FUBAR
- [x] Active combat: doesn't remove lines when combat ends (dead units should be erased after some period?)
- [x] Allied/Enemy IADS network: doesn't seem to do anything, using some debug messages I can see connections that are linked with themselves


### Save game and other files

Any campaign should do since it's mostly front-end stuff...

title: USA 2005 given access to Gepard and Marder if campaign is generated after one where those units are available
body:
### Affected versions

Development build

### Development build

https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/actions/runs/2203886120

### Description

Follow these steps precisely to replicate this:
1. Start up Liberation
2. Generate a new "The Tbilisi Gap" campaign
3. Use the default factions; Russia 1975 (Mi-24P) and Germany 1990
4. Close the squadron config screen (no changes needed). The campaign will generate.
5. Generate a "Operation Vectron's Claw" campaign
6. Use the default factions; USA 2005 and Russia 1990
7. Close the squadron config screen (no changes needed). The campaign will generate.
8. Cheat capture Sukhumi-Babushara
9. Attempt to buy AAA for one of the air defence sites at Sukhumi.
10. You will see that the Gepard is now available.
![Capture2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/72491792/164972085-0e492cf2-6cdf-4272-814d-7798f0ec2ffd.JPG)
11. Buy a SHORAD next.
12. You will see that the Roland 2 Marder is available.
![Capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/72491792/164972071-23ec618b-6b05-4c4c-bfed-8f4d5825aa06.JPG)
13. Now buy ground object, selecting Armour Group with Anti-Air as the layout.
14. You'll see that both the Gepard and Roland 2 are available.
![Capture3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/72491792/164972139-f9ed812d-03e9-4372-956c-7397abf3ce6f.JPG)

This does not happen if you don't load The Tbilisi Gap first (which has a default faction, Germany 1990, that has access to both the Gepard and the Marder). I assume this would also happen with other faction combinations, and units available to one faction "bleed across" to factions on a following campaign generation, but I didn't have the time to test any further.

### Save game and other files

Here is a savegame where the phenomenon is already present.
[Gepard and Marder in USA 2005.zip](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/8549454/Gepard.and.Marder.in.USA.2005.zip)

### Description

In 3777 the map options in the top left and top right have been changed. There is no longer a ruler or options to show culling. 

The options on the right such as 
-Control Points
-Aircraft
-Active Combat
-Air Defenses
-and so on...

These options do not appear to be functioning properly. I frequently use to disable most objects so I could focus on air defense. I can no longer do this. Most options, especially air defense, doesn't hide anything.

The threat zones on the left, the white box with three squares inside
-Blue Threat Zones
-Red Threat Zones

These do not update when swapping out air defenses until you pass turn. 

I know it is WIP but these are the issues I've noticed.

[3777.zip](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/8495666/3777.zip)

title: Supply Route Colours Displaying Incorrectly
body:
### Affected versions

Development build

### Development build

https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/actions/runs/2167015779

### Description

After starting up Liberation, if you then switch to a different save file or start a new campaign, the colours on the supply routes do not update properly. Right-click > reload is a workaround.

As an example, here's what the supply routes ought to look like at campaign start for Vegas Nerve. This is what you see if you start up Liberation and this campaign is the auto-loaded one. (essentially, the auto-loaded campaign save will display supply route colours correctly)
![Capture2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/72491792/163502845-a344bc35-9816-40bf-b556-1ed9b21f369f.JPG)

This is what they look like if Liberation loads up with a different save file in the beginning. And then afterwards, you either load up a different save file or start a new campaign.
![Capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/72491792/163503010-77b0c1e3-ee14-4e6f-b68e-f11cfc1375c3.JPG)

To replicate:
1. Start up Liberation
2. Load Scenic Route #3786.liberation (included in zip below)
3. Hit Save
4. Exit Liberation
5. Start up Liberation (Scenic Route #3776 should now be auto-loaded)
6. Load Vegas Nerve #3786.liberation (included in zip below)

title: DEAD flight with AttackGroup task fires all missiles against a single target
body:
### Affected versions

5.2.0, Development build

### Development build

_No response_

### Description

We set the AttackGroup task for DEAD flights with the property ["expend"]="All" instead of ["expend"]="Auto" like DCS does by default. This causes the AI to fire all available missiles at one single target. This makes the DEAD flight extremly uneffective.

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6678803/162049953-4cd0f82c-275a-4530-97a1-c68e3c8bad85.png)

Left is the Task in the mission file from Liberation, right is the task as i just removed the task and recreated it. 

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6678803/162050036-081e397a-7ed5-46db-b795-fe87a5049e22.png)

The expend property maps to "REL QTY". which has these possible values:
![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6678803/162050269-a21068b0-6fb2-4a73-8f71-ad6166b824f7.png)

a short test showed that the AI does what expected if its changed to AUTO.

Solution: Update Pydcs with the correct properties for this Task

title: Campaign Miz which are saved with latest DCS patch will cause "transportable" KeyError
body:
### Affected versions

5.1.0, Development build

### Development build

all

### Description

As found out in a discussion on discord the latest open beta patch changes the way how the mission editor saves the mission file in the .miz. It removes the ["transportable"] from the mission.

Left one is pre-patch, right one is post-patch mission file (both attached)
![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6678803/159040093-f7c65629-ce5c-49eb-ac61-6a2be2fd2e6d.png)

Pydcs tries to acces this key in https://github.com/pydcs/dcs/blob/master/dcs/unit.py#L91 with
```python
self.transportable = d["transportable"]
```
which causes a KeyError
![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6678803/159040338-38c995c7-e523-4ad6-b2aa-470d41a11cc6.png)

In Development this can be fixed with a PR against pydcs to handle a non existant transportable key but for 5.2 we need another solution. One solution could be to branch from the current used version and just cherry-pick the changes there.


### Save game and other files

[transportable.zip](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/8306085/transportable.zip)

title: ForceGroup from a preset group is missing optional units
body:
### Affected versions

Development build

### Development build

latest

### Description

During `_load_forces` the preset groups are loaded incorrectly. They only load all the units which are defined in the preset yaml. If there are optional units which are not defined there (Ural trucks and so on) they will not be added to the ForceGroup even if the faction actually has access to the unit.

The problem is because of this line which loads all presets as forcegroup to the armed_forces
```python
self.forces = [preset_group for preset_group in faction.preset_groups]
```

Expected:
The function should be adopted to either create a forcegroup from the layout instead which would include a check for the available units of the faction or check every given layout for the preset for available units during the faction initialization

### Save game and other files

-

title: Adding extra mission types for squadron causes error
body:
### Affected versions

Development build and 5.1 release

### Development build

https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/actions/runs/1765437916

### Description

This bug was previously reported by sncollie (https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/issues/1636), but I was not able to reproduce it at the time and the bug report was closed. Turns out, the bug occurs on Pass Turn only, not on Take Off. It is consistently replicable on clicking Pass Turn.

Set up an A-10C II squadron and decide to add DEAD to the selected mission types for that squadron. On turn 1 (after purchasing A-10s), you will find that they cannot actually be tasked for DEAD. Opening up the squadron's window in Air Wing will show DEAD is unticked. If you then tick the checkbox, you'll find that A-10s still cannot be tasked for DEAD. If you then hit Pass Turn, you'll encounter this error.

![Capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/72491792/152534128-1d712b2b-df3f-4792-b6e0-63b3bf0192bf.JPG)

Unticking the DEAD checkbox will prevent the error from occuring again. This error does not appear to trigger for every single extra mission type on every aircraft. For example, adding BARCAP/TARCAP to the F-15E works without errors (but adding DEAD causes an error). Adding TARCAP/BARCAP/DEAD to the A-10C will generate an error.

Obviously no one would (or should) be crazy enough to use A-10s for BARCAP, but I think either the option should be disabled or it should be allowed without triggering an error.

### Save game and other files

Sample save attached. DEAD checkbox already ticked. Hit pass turn to trigger error.

[Error after adding mission type.zip](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/8003217/Error.after.adding.mission.type.zip)

title: F/A-18C have inverted radio usage (possibly)
body:
### Affected versions

5.1.0

### Development build

_No response_

### Description

DCS Liberation assigns ATC & primary tactical frequencies (AWACS, etc...) on F/A-18C's Radio 2 (COMM 2), and intra-flight frequencies on Radio 1 (COMM 1). From my understanding, this would typically be the opposite in the real aircraft (taking MIDS into account).

This mudspike post has an (alleged) Hornet driver mentioning typical use of the radios. https://forums.mudspike.com/t/how-are-you-guys-using-the-radios-in-dcs/10433/67

In the attached files you can see how the carrier and the AWACS are on COMM 2 (channels 1 & 2), while the flight is on COMM 1 (channel 1). There's a tanker on COMM 2 also.

I think  this should be reversed, although the tanker can probably stay on COMM 2 (the above-mentionned post does mention having a tanker on COMM 2, although it also mentions using MIDS for intra-flight communication then).

### Save game and other files

[Uploading FA-18_radios.zip…]()

title: Squadron transfers require one more slot than total aircraft being transferred
body:
### Affected versions

5.1.0 and Dev Build

### Description

Let's say an airfield has 10 parking spots free. You can't transfer a squadron with 10 aircraft to it. You will get this error.

![Capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/72491792/149679930-c846d7a8-aebf-4419-a062-ab47fb9abab2.JPG)

However, if you sell one aircraft, the transfer will go through just fine with 9 aircraft.

To get around this issue, you can:

1. Setup the transfer with 9 aircraft, then buy 1 additional aircraft for the squadron afterwards. All 10 will be transferred.

2. Alternatively, buy another aircraft for a squadron already at the destination airfield.

Essentially, that parking spot is only unavailable when setting up the transfer.

### Save game and other files

Here's a save file created using Operation Vectron's Claw on 5.1 release. I have 13 aircraft at Sukhumi-Babushara, with 10 parking spots available. There are no pending transfers and no pending aircraft purchases.

At the "From Incirlik" mid-air spawn point, I have a squadron of F-16s with 10 aircraft, and a squadron of F-15Es with 9 aircraft. You can't transfer the F-16s (unless you delete one aircraft) but you can transfer the F-15Es.

[Transfer Test.zip](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/7878041/Transfer.Test.zip)

title: None of A2A Blue aircrafts engage the enemy aircrafts, Solution: raise the engagement distance by at least x3

labels.name: not reproducible
labels.description: Closed because the developers cannot reproduce the issue to investigate. More info needed.

body:
### Affected versions

5.0.0

### Development build

_No response_

### Description

I tried several different campaigns and noticed that 90% of blue CAP aircrafts fly straight to their death, without fighting against the enemy aircraft nor attacking any enemy bombers.
Then I went to the Mission Editor in DCS and noticed that you've set the **distance** for Enroute Task to **SearchThenEngage** to extremely low numbers, like 50km or so away from waypoint "2" which is named "JOIN". That waypoint is 100+ km away from waypoint 4 or in other words, away from Area of Operation, what explains why most of the aircrafts fly blindly to their death. I changed that distance to 3 times bigger and redid the mission, suddenly all the blue fighters actually attacked the enemy. It really looks cool on the TacView.
I really like what you did with Liberation, it's awesome and I will gladly support you guys, but can you please set this as a priority bug and fix it since all you must do is to multiply the 'max_engage_distance' by 3 and problem solved (but another introduced).
I would suggest (you don't have to listen to me ofc, it's all up to you) to make a check how far is the closest SAM area from the waypoint where you created this "Start Enroute Task" and maybe use that as a condition for max distance. It would be the best to give us, the players|users, the capability to change this distance via the UI (while also multiplying your momentarily default distance by 3 to create a new default).
Please. This Liberation is really cool and brings a joy to my heart. Thanks for all the hard work! :)

### Save game and other files

-

### Affected versions

5.0.0

### Development build

_No response_

### Description

As the title says the current SA-5 Generator always build a group with the `"SAM SA-5 S-200 ST-68U \"Tin Shield\" SR"` which can not be used by any country in the game which actually has access to the S-200 LN and RPC_5N62V TR. Example: Iran, Poland, Lybia...

Therefore the SA-5 Group will not have any SR as there will be a unit with not type which will not generate the SR.

Connected with #1903

title: default Ju-88 anti-ship uses unavailable LTF-5B
body:
### Affected versions

Development build

### Development build

develop-5.1 branch

### Description

After switching to develop-5.1 branch and updating dependencies (i.e. pydcs), it's no longer possible to edit the loadout of Ju88 flights, because the anti-ship loadout references the LTF_5B torpedo, which now causes a KeyError:

![error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48153528/147980929-6a79e2a7-c3a0-4958-9fdb-57374605f750.png)

Apparently they are right now missing in pydcs; inspecting the Ju88 entry in pydcs/dcs/planes.py, they are mentioned in error comments on lines 40294 and 40306 with

#ERRR {LTF_5B}

Changing Liberation's Anti-Ship loadout to e.g. {SC_500_L2} works as a temporary workaround. I realize this is really a pydcs issue, but filing here after discussion on Discord.




### Save game and other files

No save game or anything needed, just start a new Normandy campaign with e.g. Germany 44 as player faction, make a Ju88 flight, and double-click the flight to open the edit flight window, and it will generate the traceback:

2022-01-03 21:07:09,642 :: ERROR :: Uncaught exception

### Affected versions

5.0.0

### Development build

ME shows wrong aircraft when selected 

### Description

Morning everyone. Could sleep last night so I was messing with Liberation in the mission editor to find  this issue. I’ll try to explain it the best I can and sorry I’df this has been posted prior but I could not find it.  
in the Mission editor select an Red AI aircraft on the map. 90% of the time it would show me with an A10 when they. Should be J11. Next select another aircraft in the flight list and select on another Red AI aircraft. The aircraft will now show that it is what ever you have selected earlier. 
example: I selected my hornet in the ME and then selected Aa Red AI aircraft to see it was a hornet. Selected another aircraft like. A10 and the same Red AI aircraft is now indicating an A10. Select another one again and it carriers over. 

I thought it might be a bug with the latest DCS update but found that what I saw in the liberation mission was not the same as one created by DCS.

title: JTAC doesn´t respond to radio calls at all
body:
**Describe the bug**
I can´t get in contact with JTAC via RADIO at all, JTAC never responds to my calls. I tripple checked everything and I can´t find out why. In my  kneeboard I can see that the preset frequency is for example on my COMM2, CH4, 227.000 AM, but the JTAC ignores me on this frequency. I checked the mission editor and I found out, that the true frequency of the JTAC is different (for example 251.000 AM), but JTAC still doesn´t respond to my calls even if I change the frequency to the one I saw in the mission editor.

**To Reproduce**
This supposed bug is very easy to reproduce - this issue happens everytime I try to contact JTAC (I fly the F/A18C only). At the moment the (9-line) JTAC seems not to work at all and I can only use the autolase JTAC function and MGRS coordinates I see in the JTAC pop-up window.

**Expected behavior**
I´d appreciate if the JTAC could respond to my radio calls and give me targets and coordinations via radio, just for the better immersion.

Thx.

title: Suspicious AI purchase decisions

labels.name: not reproducible

body:
Before filing, please search the issue tracker to see if the issue has already been reported.

If reporting a DCS AI bug, check https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation#dcs-bugs.

**Describe the bug**
AI is spending money on unnecessary aircrafts which does not help the AI at all.  At the moment by a Caucasus campaign Russia (AI) decided to spend all his money by L-39 Albatros which does simply nothing compared to all other possible aircrafts in its inventory.
I.e. in Mozdok, they have 27 L-39, 2 Su-25 and 2 Su-33 which made the A/A missions a slaughter house...

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Hard to say how to reproduce as it is not simply click click issue but more a campaign time frame issue

**Expected behavior**
AI might be enhanced so that it can recognize what causes the most of the trouble for him. i.e. if the player airforces is dominating, AI should invest on reparing SAMs, buying air superioty aircrafts. If player landforces is the trouble, then land vehicles and CAS capable aircrafts. On top of this it should be able to understand which aircraft has the worst kill death ratio during the campaign and stop prefering that aircraft over others maybe.

**Additional information**

We will usually need more information for debugging. Include as much of the following as you are able:

title: 6.0 3105 - Cull Zone Bug
body:
Before filing, please search the issue tracker to see if the issue has already been reported.

If reporting a DCS AI bug, check https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation#dcs-bugs.

**Describe the bug**
SA-6 site was outside of a cull zone so it should not spawn in. I created a target for it, which should make it spawn in, even outside of a cull zone. The SA-6 site did spawn in and we destroyed it. Submitting the JSON file manually and the SA-6 site did not register any hits in liberation. All other targets inside cull zones registered hits such as a SA-3 site that was in a cull zone. 

**To Reproduce**
Build 6.0 3105 - Make sure a target is outside a cull zone
-Make that a target so it spawns in anyway
-Destroy target
-Manually submit your JSON file (in our case we use a dedicated server for missions and manually submit json files on our game machines)
-Target not destroyed or registering damage

**Expected behavior**
SA-6 site should have been destroyed.

**Additional information**

We will usually need more information for debugging. Include as much of the following as you are able:
https://www.dropbox.com/sh/i86ifie8o573x52/AAC-WoNGsU7OD4LnhvDkkSsCa?dl=0

Build 6.0 3105

title: Auto-Planner still acting as if SA-5 site is still up
body:
Release 5.0 version

Auto-planner and manual tasking of objectives are acting as if an SA-5 site is still alive.

To Reproduce - any campaign with SA-5 SAM. 
In a mission destroy both SA-5 Track and Search Radars (see attached liberation save)
Auto-Planner will create follow-up flights as if it is still active, necessitating manual manipulation of AI waypoints to other targets within the SA-5 threat ring.

As you can see, 2 of the 3 SA-5s within the campaign are destroyed. However, it's still acting as if the two destroyed ones are still active. Even assigning DEAD tasking to one, and assigning BARCAPs to fly all the way around a dead SA-5 threat ring.

title: Marianas Agat campaign squadron generation monoculture
body:
**Describe the bug**

Generates only 5 F-14B squadrons, plus support squadrons.

**To Reproduce**

1. Start new campaign
2. Select Marianas - Guam - Landing at Agat
3. Keep clicking next/finished
4. Squadron list has F-14Bs.

**Expected behavior**

At least one F/A-18C squadron, but should be more.

**Version information (please complete the following information):**
Liberation 5.0.0

**Additional information**
```
squadrons:
  Blue CV:
    - primary: BARCAP
      secondary: air-to-air
    - primary: BARCAP
      secondary: any
    - primary: Refueling
    - primary: Strike
      secondary: any
    - primary: BAI
      secondary: air-to-ground
    - primary: CAS
      secondary: air-to-ground
    - primary: AEW&C
```
Apart from AEW and Tanker, the generator selects F-14B squadrons for each of the above.

**Additional context**

The force mix you can have in this campaign is bad because:
1) More players have F-18 than F-14 and AV-8B combined (conjecture). That leaves this campaign inaccessible to most players.
2) AV-8B cannot fill the capability hole (in particular, SEAD) left by the F18. Especially not in AI hands.

The F-18 is far more common than F-14, and far more necessary for the threat environment created in this campaign.
The harrier, as available on the LHA, cannot quite fill the hole the missing f18 leaves.

**Workarounds:**
-Currently, it may require a custom faction that doesn't have tomcats.
-#1758, when released.

Solutions:

**Solutions:**
The 'easy' solution is for the above to be fixed in the campaign yaml quoted above, to prefer specific airframes.
The mount Barrigada campaign has a similar problem, missing both F18 and F16, and also using the older model A-10C.
And that's just the ones I've seen so far.

The 'hard' solution would be for a squadron to not only have a role (e.g. CAS) but each role having a 'strength' (/suitability) value for how well suited the aircraft is for that role.  The F-14 would be stronger for BARCAP/air-to-air, but the F-18 would be stronger for CAS.  And/or down-prioritizing the airframes already selected.

title: Names with apostrophes cause scripting errors
body:
## Description
This bug refers specifically to names of airbases, but will due to the nature of the issue likely translate to other names that are used as a string in the scripting environment.
If the name of the airbase/object used as a string contains an apostrophe, it will produce a mission scripting error.
For example, see **Tha'lah** airbase in the Syria map.

## To Reproduce
1. Create a liberation campaign in the Syrian theatre
2. Create a AEW&C package originating from **Tha'lah** airbase and export the mission to DCS
3. In the mission editor, in the trigger section, go to the trigger called 'Set DCS Liberation data'
4. Note here how the section **-- list the AWACs generated by Liberation** contains the created AEW&C package called something similar to ```{dcsGroupName='Tha'lah AEW&C|81|42|7|A-50|', callsign='Overlord', radio='253.0' }```
5. Launch the mission

## Expected Behaviour
Upon launching the mission, expect to receive the error ```SCRIPTING: Mission script error: [string "..."]:24: '}' expected near 'lah'```. Several modules and LUA plugin will not work if you continue the mission.
This error makes sense as the line in point 4 of the section above, contains an unclosed string.
If I manually correct the error by changing ```'Tha'lah``` into ```'Thalah``` the error message will not appear.

## Additional Information
As the mechanics of the issue are more obvious than other more complex bugs, I skip providing any saves files for now. But if this seems helpful to resolve the issue I will add them later.
- **DCS Liberation [5.0.0]**

title: Desired Mission Duration Slider - BUG
body:
**Describe the bug**
I was confused about how the Desired Mission Duration Slider worked. I was told on the discord it sets the latest a flight could take off. Setting this to the lowest setting should, in theory, get more red flights in the air, in a shorter period of time. Based on the blue auto tasking it seems setting this to 30, makes the latest TOT around 1 hour long. 

The bug I'm experiencing is changing this slider mid campaign. It seems to break the tasking. My blue flights are auto tasked but I don't have any red air doing tasks.

**To Reproduce**
-I set my current campaign from 60 minutes to 30 minutes
-Launch game and fast forward at 3x for almost 1 hour in game time.
-No enemy air as confirmed by two tacview files

**Expected behavior**
I loaded a brand new campaign and set the slider before hitting begin campaign. It worked fine. A lot more red air tasking was within the 1 hour testing window.

**Additional information**
https://www.dropbox.com/sh/h3b3oa6lcd4588g/AAAdfWdIcFMQvLnie3u9O7zDa?dl=0

Two tacview files of Nevada and the 5.0.0 save file. One tacview file of a fresh campaign showing it working properly.

NONE

title: Autogenerated frequencies for Viper
body:
Before filing, please search the issue tracker to see if the issue has already been reported.

If reporting a DCS AI bug, check https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation#dcs-bugs.

**Describe the bug**
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Start new campaign
2. Enable supercarrier, 3x income multiplier and 5000 cred on blue.
3. Automate runway repairs, fron-line purchases, and aircraft purchases.
4. Finish the setup and begin campaign.
5. Insert player in the upper right dead/sead mission

**Expected behavior**
Some of the times this will create autogenerated frequencies outside the range of the Vipers COM 2 (108.000 to 115.975 MHz).

**Additional information**
This happened 4 out of 5 times for me. I suspect it's because I am cheating with the income and the generator creates too many flights to separate the frequencies.

- DCS Liberation save file (the `.liberation` file you save from the DCS Liberation window). By default these are located in your DCS saved games directory (`%USERPROFILE%/Saved Games/DCS`).
- The generated mission file (the `.miz` file that you load in DCS to play the turn). By default these are located in your missions directory (`%USERPROFILE%/Saved Games/DCS/Missions`).
- A tacview track file, especially when demonstrating an issue with AI behavior. By default these are located in your Tacview tracks directory (`%USERPROFILE%/Documents/Tacview`).
- The state.json file from the finished mission when the problem is related to results processing. By default these are located in your Liberation install directory.

title: UI map does not update on first package deletion
body:
**Describe the bug**
Map UI does not update immediately on deletion of some packages.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Generate `Operation Peace Spring` campaign with `default` factions/settings and `auto purchase ground units` enabled.
2. Purchase lots of aircraft at `Ramat David`, specifically lots of multirole, some awacs and tankers
3. Generate campaign
4. Delete an auto generated strike package (suggest `COCKATOO` if available)
5. View that the deleted strike package still exists on the map, and can no longer be selected
6. Try to recreate the package you just deleted, and receive:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74509817/140663615-d8c9e94f-0dc0-4072-b41e-f85d1266acec.png)

**Expected behavior**
Package `Strike COCKATOO` to be removed from the map after clicking `Delete`.

**Additional information**
[3025_ui_update.zip](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/7493197/3025_ui_update.zip)
Here is the same campaign at two different save points.  Immediately before pressing `begin campaign` and immediately after.

If you use the save file from after campaign start, and try to delete strike package `COCKATOO`, the UI will not update.
Then try to recreate strike package `COCKATOO` and you will receive the error in the image.

**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - DCS Liberation `build 3025`

title: refresh selected package/flight in the UI without resetting the full ATO model
body:
https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/blob/d645b4fe73b605b380c45d67e09b11fb22807f41/qt_ui/widgets/map/mapmodel.py#L1090-L1114

Changing the flight or package selection in the UI causes a full reset of the ATO. In prior versions this can cause UI lag, but in 6.0 this can actually cause a crash because the UI may be updating in another thread which can cause a `FlightJs` to be GC'd while the js side is still using it. I'm reasonably certain of that diagnosis because if I disable the signals for package/flight selection change then I can rapidly change packages with the sim running without any crashes, but with them connected it crashes fairly easily.

Locking would be tricky because we would need to expose a lock/unlock API to js, but we can avoid the problem _and_ improve performance by instead notifying the model of a change in selected status instead of rebuilding the whole flight list when the package or flight changes.

title: Tu-95MS, Tu-160, F-117A, Tornado GR4 have OCA/Runway mission type by default but they cannot carry ordnance to support mission type
body:
**Describe the bug**
The Tu-95MS and Tu-160 can do strike, DEAD, and OCA/Runway mission types by default. However, they can only carry cruise missiles. The F-117A and Tornado GR4 only carry laser guided bombs. Since OCA/Runway cannot be performed with guided munitions (AI will not use them against runways), OCA/Runway mission type ought to be removed from the defaults for these aircraft.

**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - #2976

title: No attack orders given to anti-ship flights when enemy carrier is the target
body:
**Describe the bug**
Mikef brought this to our attention on Discord and I did some testing to verify. There don't appear to be any orders on the ingress waypoint (or any other waypoint for that matter) directing an anti-ship flight to attack their intended target (edit: only applies when target is a carrier). They fly to the ingress waypoint and then RTB. This applies to both Hornets and Vikings, and the bug exists in both the latest dev build #2976 and 4.1.1. I wonder if some DCS update has broken this because I know it was working a while back.

![Capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/72491792/139528451-dcec15f6-dbf4-454a-9e9d-aa0f49522d9e.JPG)

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Buy Hornets or Vikings.
2. Give them an anti-ship mission (edit: with a carrier as the target).
3. Look at ingress waypoint in mission editor.
4. There are no orders.

**Expected behavior**
Anti-ship flights should fire their missiles.

**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - This issue currently exists on both #2976 and the 4.1.1 release build.

title: Campaign airfield/role definitions preclude all but the first aircraft type defined
body:
1. Create a new campaign of type "Syria - Operation Peace Spring" using default factions
2. Note that the E-3A is not available for purchase even though it is defined for Bluefor Modern
3. The E-2 Hawkeye is defined as the primary AEW&C aircraft type in operation_peace_spring.yaml
4. Add the E-3A as a second aircraft type
5. Reload Liberation, recreate campaign and E-3A still does not appear
6. Also tested by flipping the F-18 and M-2000 order for TARCAP from

 - primary: TARCAP
      secondary: any
      aircraft:
        - Mirage 2000C
        - F/A-18C Hornet (Lot 20)
       
to

 - primary: TARCAP
      secondary: any
      aircraft:
        - F/A-18C Hornet (Lot 20)
        - Mirage 2000C

7. Reload Liberation, recreate campaign and Mirage 2000C magically disappears from the campaign and is unpurchaseable

Summary:

It appears that only the first aircraft type in the definition for a particular airfield/role is being loaded into the campaign.

**Describe the bug**
After several turns in the campaign, suddenly all AI aircrafts don't carry out CAS missions anymore. They still fly through the waypoints, but they go directly Ingress-CAS-Egress and leave immediately instead of staying in the mission zone and carrying out the mission.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Load the problematic campaign save file
2. Click "Take off" and run the mission
3. Observe the AI behavior of CAS packages and see the problematic behavior

**Expected behavior**
AI aircrafts should stay in the mission zone and carry out CAS mission

**Additional information**
[CAS bug.zip](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/7285736/CAS.bug.zip)

**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - DCS Liberation 4.1.1

**Additional context**
The CAS behavior was normal in the first few turns. Then it stopped working all in a sudden. Removing the flight packages and creating new CAS packages doesn't solve this issue. Dragging Ingress-CAS-Egress waypoints apart from each other also doesn't solve this issue. It seems that the Egress waypoint disappears automatically with the CAS waypoint even if the aircrafts haven't reached the Egress waypoint yet.

title: F-86 Unable to be controlled in DCS 2.7.6.12852
body:
Before filing, please search the issue tracker to see if the issue has already been reported.

If reporting a DCS AI bug, check https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation#dcs-bugs.

**Describe the bug**
F-86 player slots are unplayable in Liberation 4.1.1 missions in DCS 2.7.6.12852.  From a cold start aircraft, the view slews uncontrollably in-cockpit and the aircraft itself rubber-bands all over the place.  Initial testing showed the P-51 working fine, but now the P-51 is affected as well.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create a multiplayer Liberation mission with F-86 client slots using DCS 2.7.6.
2. Select an F-86 client slot and spawn in.
3. Issue manifests immediately.

**Expected behavior**
Player should spawn into the aircraft with full control as normal.

**Additional information**

We will usually need more information for debugging. Include as much of the following as you are able:

- DCS Liberation save file (the `.liberation` file you save from the DCS Liberation window). By default these are located in your DCS saved games directory (`%USERPROFILE%/Saved Games/DCS`).
- The generated mission file (the `.miz` file that you load in DCS to play the turn). By default these are located in your missions directory (`%USERPROFILE%/Saved Games/DCS/Missions`).
- A tacview track file, especially when demonstrating an issue with AI behavior. By default these are located in your Tacview tracks directory (`%USERPROFILE%/Documents/Tacview`).
- The state.json file from the finished mission when the problem is related to results processing. By default these are located in your Liberation install directory.

**Version information (please complete the following information):**

title: Carrier-capable aircraft cannot be placed at airfields by campaign designers
body:
**Describe the bug**
Defaults for the squadron bases field exclude carrier capable aircraft from shore-based airfields. This means squadrons of carrier-capable aircraft like Tomcats and Hornets cannot be placed at airfields.

https://i.imgur.com/hUzl8P8.png

**Expected behavior**
Campaign designers should be able to place squadrons with carrier capable aircraft at airfields.

While this can be fixed by placing
bases:
    carrier: true
    shore: true
in the YAML file of every single carrer capable aircraft squadron, it would be preferable to just fix the defaults in /squadrons/operatingbases.py

**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - DCS Liberation #2880

title: None-FARP-usable aircraft being purchased/tasked at FOB after squadron falllback post-capture
body:
**Describe the bug**
After an airbase capture, squadrons for aircraft that are not FARP-capable (e.g. Su-25) are falling back to the next FOB control point instead of to the nearest air base. At the FOB, the squadrons can purchase aircraft that cannot be placed on FARPs, leading to them spawning in mid air.

**Expected behavior**
Squadrons from airfields (with the possible exception of chopper/harrier squadrons) should fall back to the nearest airfield when their airfield is captured instead of to a FOB.

**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - DCS Liberation #2870

title: [Build 2849] Squadron Mission Preference Bug
body:
When creating the squadron list in a campaign YAML, there are certain taskings or groups of taskings that are not compatible in either the primary task list or secondary task list.

As discussed on Discord, It seems like A2A, A2G, and Any are the only ones that work for secondary tasks and you can't use specific task names. Conversely, primary tasks have to use specific task names and can't be A2A or A2G. Attempting to add a specific task name will generate an error pictured below:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/72566076/132732210-cf4aa00e-9913-4b73-985d-94cfbc14ced9.png)


**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - Build 2849

title: Wizard ignores if "use Super-Carrier Module" is ticked or not
body:
Before filing, please search the issue tracker to see if the issue has already been reported.
_Probably related to, but works the opposite way: [ Super Carrier Selected Still Places Stennis #1214 ](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/issues/1214)_

If reporting a DCS AI bug, check https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation#dcs-bugs.
_Not a DCS AI bug._

**Describe the bug**
_If there are both super-carrier and non-super-carrier carriers in the faction's file unit list, there is chances that, when I do not tick the "use super-carrier module" box in the wizard, the carrier will still be from the super-carrier module when starting the campaign. Tried on several campaign on caucasus and syria and it's always the same thing, I have to restart the wizard over and over until it's a Stennis that pops up eventually._

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. _New Campaign (any)_
2. _In the Wizard do **NOT** tick "Use Super-Carrier Module"._
3. _Select a faction with **BOTH** Super-Carrier carriers and the vanilla CVN 74 John C. Stennis._
4. _When ready to go, finish and close the Wizard._
5. _Check which carrier has spawned._

**Expected behavior**
_A CVN 74 John C. Stennis has spawned._

**Additional information**
_Sometimes it's not a CVN 74 John C. Stennis that spawns but a carrier from the Super-Carrier Module._

We will usually need more information for debugging. Include as much of the following as you are able:

- DCS Liberation save file (the `.liberation` file you save from the DCS Liberation window). By default these are located in your DCS saved games directory (`%USERPROFILE%/Saved Games/DCS`).

- The generated mission file (the `.miz` file that you load in DCS to play the turn). By default these are located in your missions directory (`%USERPROFILE%/Saved Games/DCS/Missions`).
_[liberation_nextturn.zip](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/7116151/liberation_nextturn.zip)_
- A tacview track file, especially when demonstrating an issue with AI behavior. By default these are located in your Tacview tracks directory (`%USERPROFILE%/Documents/Tacview`).
_I didn't fly the mission._
- The state.json file from the finished mission when the problem is related to results processing. By default these are located in your Liberation install directory.
_I didn't fly the mission._

title: Players' flight intra flight frequencies (on COMM1 channel1) are not correct
body:
**Describe the bug**

Most players' intra flight frequencies, on COMM1 channel1, are not correct: they don't match the frequencies that can be seen in liberation_nextturn.miz under the mission editor.

Please note that the kneeboards show the correct intra flight frequencies, so another way to reformulate the bug is: most players' COMM1 channel1 frequencies are not correct: they don't match the frequencies found in the kneeboards.

(Please also note that all COMM2 frequencies, ie COMM2 channel 1/2/3/4 are all correct, as per the mission editor and the kneeboards)

Example: I am starting this campaign:

![Capture d’écran (12)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/90111363/132106057-c548161c-61d0-467a-9a85-477a0a87cba7.png)

There are 4 players flights:
- SEAD RAVEN
- strike MONKEY
- strike WOMBAT
- BARCAP Truman

I press the START button and then load the generated liberation_nextturn.miz in the mission editor. In the mission editor I check the various intra flight frequencies. It says:

- SEAD RAVEN: 118 Mhz
- strike MONKEY: 123 Mhz
- strike WOMBAT: 119 Mhz
- BARCAP Truman: 120 Mhz

I close the mission editor, launch a hosted server in the DCS multiplayer panel, load liberation_nextturn.miz, choose one of the players' slots and press FLY. Once in the plane (they are all F18s), I start the right engine so that I can check the COMM1 channel1 frequency. I do this for all 4 players flights, here are the results:

- SEAD RAVEN: 123 Mhz
- strike MONKEY: 123 Mhz
- strike WOMBAT: 123 Mhz
- BARCAP Truman: 123 Mhz


**Additional information**

I have the liberation save, and the liberation_nextturn.miz available, but this is my first time posting here and I have not been able to figure out how to join files (?)


**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - DCS Liberation 4.1.1

[Golan bot1.zip](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/7111056/Golan.bot1.zip)
[liberation_nextturn.zip](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/7111057/liberation_nextturn.zip)

title: AI attacking only single units with multiple munitions (overkill)+ ghost targets
body:
Possible two part bug:
1 - AI-assets attacking the same target with multiple individual weapons even though the target is very likely to be killed (ovekill). AI may spend a full load on a single unit, ie. BTR killed with 4 mavericks, 4 JDAMs/GBUs, leaving other units in the target location unharmed.
2 - AI attacking targets not visible, or missing its target but would have hit if the targets didn't move.  Are targets for the AI generated by coordinates, rather than the actual unit?

**Describe the bug**
The bug seems to be in two parts

1: (Waste of munitions) 
Loading up an AI-aircraft with AG-weapons tasked with SEAD/DEAD or Strike mission, the AI engages the same target with multiple individual weapons of the same type, wasting the loadout and will only be able to kill a single target. 

In the attached tacview file, a group of 4 Harriers are tasked with engaging a group of 8 T80Us (Target location Fennec). Each Harrier engages one single tank with all of its munitions (4 mavericks). The rest of the tanks are unengaged, meaning the attack is very uneffective.

2: (Coordinates, rather than units?) 
In the attached tacview file the same group of 8 T80Us are attacked by a total of 16 AGM65Fs launched from Harriers (Target location Fennec). The first maverick hit and kills its target. The other tanks are spooked and starts to move immediately for a couple of meters. The rest of the mavericks impact the ground where the rest of the targets initially stood. Are targets generated on the basis of coordinates, rather than actual units?

**To Reproduce**
Make the AI engage a location with multiple targets. Load the aircraft with several weapons of the same kind, ie. several AGM65Fs, or several GBU38 JDAM

**Expected behavior**
1: I would expect the AI to engage a single target with the necessary amount of munitions, or do several passes to kill the target, not use all its munitions in one run on the same, single unit.

2: I would expect Fire-and-forget weapons, or weapons that needs to be directed to the target (ie. weapons directed by laser-targeting) to hit its target. Instead the weapons seems to be locked at a location, rather than a individual unit.

**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - DCS Liberation 4.1.1

[Files collection.zip](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/7034547/Files.collection.zip)

title: Sell Aircraft counter not working (UI)
body:
I've encountered a but using the Airfield Command UI to buy and sell airplanes.

**Describe the bug**
Whenever I sell some airplanes from a base, the UI does not show the number I'm selling. (Previously it counted -1, -2, -3 and so forth.) Now the number stays at 0. But the planes do get sold - it's just the UI not showing you how many times you pressed the red minus key.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Buy some planes on a base or carrier.
2. Pass turn
3. Try to sell some of the planes.
4. The sale works, but you have no UI indication of the amount you asked to be sold. (UI stays at "0")

**Expected behavior**
I expected the counter to show me a negative amount. -1, -2, -3 and so on.
It works like before if you buy planes, but not if you sell them.

**Additional information**

We will usually need more information for debugging. Include as much of the following as you are able:

- DCS Liberation save file (the `.liberation` file you save from the DCS Liberation window). By default these are located in your DCS saved games directory (`%USERPROFILE%/Saved Games/DCS`).
- The generated mission file (the `.miz` file that you load in DCS to play the turn). By default these are located in your missions directory (`%USERPROFILE%/Saved Games/DCS/Missions`).
- A tacview track file, especially when demonstrating an issue with AI behavior. By default these are located in your Tacview tracks directory (`%USERPROFILE%/Documents/Tacview`).
- The state.json file from the finished mission when the problem is related to results processing. By default these are located in your Liberation install directory.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/88510768/129107785-28214f07-b717-4f15-a151-d37b0a3eba93.png)

**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - DCS Liberation v. 4.1.1
[Danica - Cauc MOD Testing - Turn 04a.zip](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/6971593/Danica.-.Cauc.MOD.Testing.-.Turn.04a.zip)

(In the screenshot I have 3 x Warthog in stock. I've pressed the Sell key 3 times without getting any change in the number. At the 4th press I got the error that I had no more to sell. So the logic is counting down. It's just the UI now showing it.


**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

title: Su-34 should not be listed as CAP capable aircaft
body:
**Describe the bug**
Though Su34 is capable of using R77, it is NOT a Fighter, it's a tactical bomber to replace Su24, not a Su30/F15E kind multi-role fighter. The R-77 or R-27 is for self defence only. 
And since Su-34 is R77 capable, it seems that the ATO will even pick Su-34 rather than Su-27(Only R-27 capable) for CAP mission in some case, which cause a total mess in auto mission planning. 

**To Reproduce**
Choose any faction with Su34.

**Expected behavior**
Remove Su-34 from CAP capable list.

**Additional information**
And We don't call this as CAP capable, right?
![Su-39_02](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74572837/128841439-d2527e82-ef41-4a9b-ae95-6cad4f6666ec.jpg)

title: PATRIOT STR with the "auto pointing on center of conflict" feature
body:
Hey guys, just a little feedback about the new "SAM pointing on center of conclict" feature, comes with the 4.1.0. 

We still have an issue with the Patriot STR, even with the new "auto center to central point of conflict" feature. The Patriot STR is not gimballed and have to be pointed on the good heading to be able to perform. 

The issue comes from the positioning of the STR in the "template" of the Patriot Site itself in the mission generation. It could be fixed by changing the heading of the STR itself in the template, or by adding more STR to cover more azimuths.

![lib1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82789122/128780767-a48623c6-fc1a-4f1d-9003-6f27a3e23a46.jpg)

title: "Allowed Mission Types"~ Squadrons don't follow their Roles
body:
Before filing, please search the issue tracker to see if the issue has already been reported.

If reporting a DCS AI bug, check https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation#dcs-bugs.

**Describe the bug**
Squadrons that have specific mission types don't follow them. The UI always seem to prioritize 1 squadron for flight scheduling before moving to the next squadron.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Any Dev build since implementation. Current build #2716

**Expected behavior**
-A squadron set for only ground war should not be scheduled for Air war, and vice versa

**Additional information**

We will usually need more information for debugging. Include as much of the following as you are able:

- DCS Liberation save file (the `.liberation` file you save from the DCS Liberation window). By default these are located in your DCS saved games directory (`%USERPROFILE%/Saved Games/DCS`).
- The generated mission file (the `.miz` file that you load in DCS to play the turn). By default these are located in your missions directory (`%USERPROFILE%/Saved Games/DCS/Missions`).
- A tacview track file, especially when demonstrating an issue with AI behavior. By default these are located in your Tacview tracks directory (`%USERPROFILE%/Documents/Tacview`).
- The state.json file from the finished mission when the problem is related to results processing. By default these are located in your Liberation install directory.

**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - DCS Liberation [e.g. 2.3.1]:

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

title: patrol speed fix broke save compat from 4.0

**To Reproduce**

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Open [save-compat-4.liberation.txt](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/6936341/save-compat-4.liberation.txt)
2. Click take off

**Expected behavior**
Mission generated

title: Weather presets not working on Syria map
body:
**Describe the bug**
At least on the Syria map, weather presets do not appear to be working. I am using Spring 95 and SchmokedPancake is using Summer 2021, and we are both only getting clear skies on every turn. Not certain if this is specific to Syria map, but it is definitely occuring on that map.

#2676 Preview

title: Flight Plan display bug hides all flights plans when any other option is selected after clicking Show All
body:
**Describe the bug**
After Clicking "Show All" under Flight Plans, clicking Show Selected Blue, Show All Blue, or Show All Red will Hide all Flight Plans instead of showing the correct selection.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Click Show All
2. Click any of the 3 options above it
3. All Flight plans get hidden

#2676 Preview

title: Liberation (#2653) crashes if log window is open when entering mission
body:
**Describe the bug**
The new log window implementation causes Liberation to crash to desktop if the log is open when mission starts up. The log window also cannot be scrolled through (and also appears to no longer update) once "Take Off" is hit, which significantly reduces its utility.

**To Reproduce**
1. Open log window
2. Hit Take Off
3. Start mission in DCS
4. Liberation crashes

title: "Accept results" button not doing anything when finishing a mission.

This has happened twice already and the first time I had to restart the campaign when I was already pretty advanced. Today I finished a mission and when I clicked "Accept Results", nothing happened. Asked in the Liberation discord and they asked me to file a bug with the Stage.json file and my liberation save.

title: [Build 2511] AI Planner Purchasing a Confusingly Large Amount of Tankers
body:
In the campaign my group is running, we noticed that the Red side had purchased 18 tankers as illustrated below.

![](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/844372015989129216/870175091139420200/unknown.png)

The intended behavior I suppose is that it shouldn't buy that many. Maybe Just 1 planned for each frontline and 1 or 2 each in reserve?

Saves and miz attached below.

title: JAS 39 Gripen - Loadouts not appearing correctly in missions
body:
**Describe the bug**
In both the A-A and A-G versions of the Gripen, the loadouts in liberation do not match what is there in-game. For example in liberation, ill try to set a default cap loadout with 4 asraams, but in-game it bugs out and the only thing there is an ecm pod. The same thing happens in the A-G version. For players, this can easily be fixed in-game by requesting the ground crew to rearm, but the ai aircraft can't do this. 

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Set up a flight with either a-a or a-g loadout
2. observe the error in the mission

**Expected behavior**
For the correct loadout to be there

SAVEFILE: 
https://www.filemail.com/d/uqpoqnmvzjwnqlo
file link only lasts for 1 week, if requested I can send it again

**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - DCS Liberation  4.0.0

title: SA-8/SA-13 unit files duplicate
body:
There are three unit files related to the sa-8 and sa-13
SA-8 Osa LD 9T217.yaml
Osa 9a33 ln.yaml
Strela-10M3.yaml
There is some mix up in these. The first file has information regarding the SA-8, but lists the SA-13 as its only variant. The second file only contains a price and variant (so no description, role, class etc). The Strela-10M3 file appears to be correct.

Remove the Sa-8 Osa LD 9T217 file and verify the other files are correct

If reporting a DCS AI bug, check https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation#dcs-bugs.
