"Take-Off" generates this error:


Before filing, please search the issue tracker to see if the issue has already been reported.

If reporting a DCS AI bug, check https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation#dcs-bugs.

A link for my .liberation file is https://drive.google.com/file/d/1To2uNxGEy5Xe0VPU4BU7idkIow7jfi6L/view?usp=sharing

title: Kneeboard doesn't show elevation for strike targets
body:
I'm not sure if this is supposed to be in feature requests, but:

In strike-packages, the kneeboards show the coordinates for the strike targets. This is very useful for setting up JDAM's, SLAM's, JSOW's etc., but the page doesn't show the elevation of the targets, so you still need to find this in ME or F10 map.

The coordinates added a lot of immersion, especially in VR, since you can punch in the coords during cold start and stay immersed, in stead of a) looking through F10 or b) lifting your VR headset to look through your hand written notes. 

TL;DR: Having the elevation (in feet) would allow us to stay immersed and away from ME/F10 while doing strike missions.

Thanks for all the work you do, guys!

title: US Navy 2005 Faction Update
body:
A few ground-based assets were incorrectly present in my US Navy 2005 faction when they were never deployed with either the USMC or USN. I've corrected this by replacing the M113 and M163 VADS with the AAV-7 and M1097 HMMWV Avenger respectively. 
[usn_2005.zip](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/6807193/usn_2005.zip)

title: CAP load for JF17
body:
Before filing, please search the issue tracker to see if the issue has already been reported.

If reporting a DCS AI bug, check https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation#dcs-bugs.

**Describe the bug**
Not exactly a bug but a mistake on the default load for CAP for the JF17: the default load gives the WDM7 POD wich is actually for CAS. FOr CAP the jf17 shpuld have the KG-600 (electronic countermeasures)

 - DCS Liberation [e.g. 2.3.1]: 4.0

title: Liberation Ignores "Disabled" Automatic Package Planning Behavior Setting
body:
Before filing, please search the issue tracker to see if the issue has already been reported.

If reporting a DCS AI bug, check https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation#dcs-bugs.

**Describe the bug**

Even if "Disabled" is selected under Settings > Campaign Management > Automatic package planning behavior, packages are auto generated.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create New Campaign
2. Go to "Settings > Campaign Management > Automatic package planning", and select "Disabled".
3. Purchase some aircraft.
4. Click on "Begin Campaign"
5. See auto generated packages/missions.

**Expected behavior**

No packages should be generated for player side by AI.

**Additional information**

We will usually need more information for debugging. Include as much of the following as you are able:

- DCS Liberation save file (the `.liberation` file you save from the DCS Liberation window). By default these are located in your DCS saved games directory (`%USERPROFILE%/Saved Games/DCS`).
- The generated mission file (the `.miz` file that you load in DCS to play the turn). By default these are located in your missions directory (`%USERPROFILE%/Saved Games/DCS/Missions`).
- A tacview track file, especially when demonstrating an issue with AI behavior. By default these are located in your Tacview tracks directory (`%USERPROFILE%/Documents/Tacview`).
- The state.json file from the finished mission when the problem is related to results processing. By default these are located in your Liberation install directory.

**Version information (please complete the following information):**

- This behavior is seen in Build #2424

title: Successful Anti-Convoy BAI Results in *Next* Turn Mission Generation Failing
body:
**Describe the bug**

If in turn $n$, a mission against a ground convoy has some success (ground vehicles destroyed), then the subsequent round fails to generate a mission, with

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "widgets\QTopPanel.py", line 289, in launch_mission
  File "game\game.py", line 277, in initiate_event
  File "game\event\event.py", line 65, in generate
  File "game\operation\operation.py", line 303, in generate
  File "game\operation\operation.py", line 400, in _generate_ground_conflicts
KeyError: 1001
```


**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Frag a mission against a convoy
2. In DCS: Destroy some vehicles in convoy
3. Back in Liberation, set up another mission(s), and click "Take Off"
4. See error

**Expected behavior**

Successful mission generation.

**Additional information**

- This bug data was generated under build #2406
   - 20210628.02.liberation: Save file from previous (non-failing turn) for mission with convoy strike
   -  20210628.04.liberation: Save file for subsequent turn, that actually fails to generate DCS miz file
   - state.json: results from: "20210628.02.liberation"

[Saves.zip](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/6759680/Saves.zip)
[log.txt](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/6759683/log.txt)

- However, the last time I ran an anti-convoy BAI mission, I saw a very similar error. This was an earlier build, and unfortunately, I have lost the save file and mission file. The errior message was different, however:
```
Traceback (most recent call last):

  File "game\game.py", line 276, in initiate_event

  File "gen\convoygen.py", line 31, in generate

  File "gen\convoygen.py", line 63, in _create_mixed_unit_group

IndexError: list index out of range
```

title: Icon for the ruler missing
body:
**Describe the bug**
Rulericon does not show up in the top left of the map.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Start the Application
2. Rulericon is missing

**Expected behavior**
Rulericon visible

**Additional information**
Brocktunes and I checked canvas.html in "...\DCS Liberation\resources\ui\map" but the hash code was correct.

The ruler is there, just the Icon is missing. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13836400/124154431-c67d1300-da95-11eb-9f78-98c29471339d.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13836400/124154348-b2d1ac80-da95-11eb-9c1d-31676cd81faa.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13836400/124154377-b9602400-da95-11eb-80ea-b44d23447794.png)


Application Log: "ERROR :: Failed to find a valid digest in the 'integrity' attribute for resource 'https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/gokertanrisever/leaflet-ruler@master/src/leaflet-ruler.css' with computed SHA-256 integrity 'NiTOTeCvHLlpOldf3VI9EgNHSUTBQJ2kquhh4hTl/Bk='. The resource has been blocked."

**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - DCS Liberation **4.0.0**

title: New Cloud Base Display crashes the game if weather has no clouds
body:
**Describe the bug**
Commit https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/commit/f80696b7244d2eace20111dacdcb149cb4747055 adds line 117 to QTopPanel.py. If the game.conditions.weather has no clouds this will cause an Attribute Error `(<class 'AttributeError'>, AttributeError("'NoneType' object has no attribute 'base'"), <traceback object at 0x000002D062955180>)`

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Open new campaign
2. Click on Begin Campaign
3. Click so long on next turn till the weather has no clouds
4. See error if no clouds visible

**Expected behavior**
No Error.

title: Incorrect composition of Silkworm ASM Battery in Syria-Lebanon 2005 (Allied Sword) Faction
body:
**Describe the bug**

The Silkworm Anti-Shipping Missile Battery for the Syria-Lebanon 2005 (Allied Sword) Faction has 6x Silkworm search Radars (AShM Silkworm SR) and no launchers (AShM SS-N-2 Silkworm). This makes the site harmless to ships. 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40154322/124128570-4324e700-dac0-11eb-8c78-168a163836bc.png)

**To Reproduce**

1. create a campaign that utilises the Syria-Lebanon 2005 (Allied Sword) Faction and includes locations for anti-shipping missile sites.
2. 'Take off'
3. View Silkworm Site in editor, note that it has no missiles launchers.

**Expected behaviour**

The Silkworm site should consist of 5-6 Silkworm launchers (AShM SS-N-2 Silkworm) and only 1-2 Radar vans (AShM Silkworm SR). This will allow it to target ships. The site should also retain its ancillary vehicles (SA9/ZSU23-4 and KAMAZ truck).

title: very poor map performance

labels.name: not reproducible
labels.description: Closed because the developers cannot reproduce the issue to investigate. More info needed.

body:
Since 3.0 I have really poor map performance when scrolling, zooming or moving waypoints. It feels like taking hours when I want to move the map or anything. It seems that the menu itself is very slow for some reason.

Can't be hardware related. Quiet a good machine at my end with a 9900K + 3090

I really hope I can get some help to fix this. Mission planing is almost impossible right now!

title: Can't enter cockpit with delayed start (dedicated server)

labels.name: dcs issue
labels.description: We think that this issue is a DCS World or a third party issue that cannot be resolved by us.

body:
**Description**
When running the mission through a dedicated server, I cannot enter the cockpit when I have a delayed start. When running the same mission in single player I have no issue, the pilot spawns in at the exact departure time. When I change the departure time to 0:00 it also works, I immediately enter the cockpit. Just delayed start in multiplayer is not working.

**To Reproduce**
Run the .miz through a dedicated server, choose the role of pilot, and wait until the departure time. (14:10:41)

**Expected behavior**
Being able to enter cockpit at designated departure time.

**Additional information**

Dedicated server is running on the same machine, with default settings (followed the Wiki). Joined the server by entering the localhost IP (127.0.0.1:10308)

Zip-file containing state.json, .miz and .liberation file:
[https://drive.google.com/file/d/1hfLzSn_DOjZrO5T5R9xVxt7hmFsgzHPg/view?usp=sharing](url)

**Version information**
 - DCS Liberation 4.0 + Latest DCS open beta (2.7.3.8494)

title: :: Uncaught TypeError: L.control.ruler is not a function
body:
It was fully working on Liberation 4 review (build was 21xx, I cant remember the exact number) but now when loading I get no map and error. On the bottom right of the map there is just a link to leaflet website.

2021-06-30 08:39:15,815 :: DEBUG :: Map reset took 0:00:00.049442
2021-06-30 08:39:17,283 :: ERROR :: Uncaught TypeError: L.control.ruler is not a function

If I try and refresh the map it just gives the error again. tried a fresh location and get exactly the same thing happening. I can confirm my computer can reach https://tile.openstreetmap.org/ and https://www.openstreetmap.org/copyright

Please keep up the great work Liberation is amamzing.

title: Operation Atilla Campaign - Lakatamia unsuitable for fixed wing aircraft.
body:
Before filing, please search the issue tracker to see if the issue has already been reported.

If reporting a DCS AI bug, check https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation#dcs-bugs.

**Describe the bug**
Lakatamia (central Cyprus) is a small helicopter base. Obv. the campaign has no way of knowing this, so the AI will base fixed wing aircraft there, which are unable to take off.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create an Operation Atilla Campaign (tested with default factions, reduced money/income)
2. Start the campaign, and check the intel for Lakatamia to make sure fixed wing aircraft have been based there.
3. Launch the mission in DCS.
4. See the AI attempt to take off from Lakatamia - usually resulting in the first aircraft crashing, and subsequent aircraft sitting there.

**Expected behavior**
Campaign shouldn't base fixed wing aircraft out of Lakatamia, although i'm aware this is probably currently a limitation in Liberation or DCS - might have to just remove it from places you can base aircraft?

**Additional information**
[liberation_nextturn.zip](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/6727400/liberation_nextturn.zip)
[airfield_bug.zip](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/6727431/airfield_bug.zip)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18265865/123662454-65eb9d00-d82d-11eb-9d59-b424da488e09.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18265865/123662516-756ae600-d82d-11eb-9305-149f38e6bfdb.png)

**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - DCS Liberation 4.0.0

title: [Build #2202] Liberation fails to generate campaign using Operation Blackball preset using some player factions
body:
When attempting to generate a campaign using the Operation Blackball preset, using some player faction presets (such as Syria 2011 or Syria 2012'ish) with the default settings leads to liberation throwing an incompatible version error:

> The save game you have loaded is incompatible with this version of DCS Liberation.
> 
> Traceback (most recent call last):
>   File "windows\QLiberationWindow.py", line 296, in setGame
>   File "widgets\map\QLiberationMap.py", line 58, in set_game
>   File "widgets\map\mapmodel.py", line 834, in reset
>   File "widgets\map\mapmodel.py", line 963, in reset_threat_zones
>   File "game\game.py", line 511, in threat_zone_for
> AttributeError: 'Game' object has no attribute 'blue_threat_zone'

Interestingly enough, the same error does **not appear** when using Syria 2011 or Syria 2012'ish as the enemy faction.

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Attempt to generate new campaign
2. Choose player faction Syria 2011 or Syria 2012'ish
3. Leave settings at default and click 'Finish'
4. See error

**Additional information**
[liberation.log](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/6718762/liberation.log)

Liberation version: v.4.0.0-2202

EDIT: Issue originally discovered on build 2214, but also present on 4.0.0-2202 build

title: AI Su-33 Fails to take off from Kuznetsov

labels.name: dcs issue
labels.description: We think that this issue is a DCS World or a third party issue that cannot be resolved by us.

body:
Before filing, please search the issue tracker to see if the issue has already been reported.

If reporting a DCS AI bug, check https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation#dcs-bugs.

**Describe the bug**
AI controlled Su-33s are unable to take off from Admiral Kuznetsov. They are set to "take off from ramp" and are spawned partially clipping into the raised blast shields.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Create any campaign with Su-33s and Admiral Kuznetsov (without supercarrier). Assign Su-33's to a mission. 

**Expected behavior**
Su-33's spawn without clipping and are able to take off.

**Additional information**

While this is probably a DCS bug with the free Admiral Kuznetsov there is a workaround that would allow Su-33s to use the free Admiral Kuznetsov module. If the 
![take off from ramp](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/69350650/123423229-83dea680-d57c-11eb-8acb-1e6b35bd4a7f.png)
![take off from runway](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/69350650/123423276-948f1c80-d57c-11eb-8e75-b5e433a35daa.png)
[Missions.zip](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/6716028/Missions.zip)
Su-33s take off waypoint is set to "take off from runway" instead of "take off from ramp", that Liberation currently uses by default, the Su-33s spawn without clipping and are able to take off.

- DCS Liberation save file (the `.liberation` file you save from the DCS Liberation window). By default these are located in your DCS saved games directory (`%USERPROFILE%/Saved Games/DCS`).
- The generated mission file (the `.miz` file that you load in DCS to play the turn). By default these are located in your missions directory (`%USERPROFILE%/Saved Games/DCS/Missions`).
- A tacview track file, especially when demonstrating an issue with AI behavior. By default these are located in your Tacview tracks directory (`%USERPROFILE%/Documents/Tacview`).
- The state.json file from the finished mission when the problem is related to results processing. By default these are located in your Liberation install directory.

**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - DCS Liberation [e.g. 2.3.1]:

**Additional context**

title: Syria full map - Map-baked factories' destruction not tracked (changed object IDs?)
body:
**Describe the bug**

Upon successfully destroying factories, they are not registered as destroyed in the liberation app.
This does not apply to liberation-placed objectives (oil rigs etc) which are still destroyed just fine.

Probable cause is the updated syria map, adding cyprus, changing the IDs of all map baked objects.

Fixing this will likely break dcs stable until it is updated, comparable factions including the new hind.

**To Reproduce**

1. Load liberation, 3.0, develop_3.x, develop. (develop-4.x untested, presumably still a problem)
2. Create new campaign using syria full map
3. Plot mission to strike factories, for example the three buildings just south of bassel al-assad, or the NDB beacon tower north of it.
4. Using current OB with the changed syria map
5. Destroy the target, finish the mission

**Expected behavior**

Upon entering the planning stage for the next turn, the destroyed factories should be removed from the map.

**Additional information**

**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - DCS Liberation [e.g. 2.3.1]:

**Additional context**
Other syria campaigns should probably also be checked.

2. observe that the appended name appears to be the last one you saved

title: [Build #2087] Exception when clicking on AA ground object after reload
body:
**Describe the bug**
Exception when i click on a AA ground object after i reopenend liberation and loaded my fresh created campaign
`File "D:\workspace\dcs_liberation\qt_ui\windows\groundobject\QGroundObjectMenu.py", line 232, in update_total_value
    unit_type = next(GroundUnitType.for_dcs_type(vehicles.vehicle_map[u.type]))
StopIteration`

Seems to be happening only with AA Groups

This only occurs after the 2nd time opening the application! Directly after creation it works perfectly.
Fun Fact: If you freshly open liberation, create a random campaign, close this one and reopen the previous campaign its working.

I think something was not initialized when no campaign generation is hit...

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create new campaign (I used Caucasus Full)
2. Click on AA Ground object (Example a patriot battery)
3. Save the game as new file
4. Completly close liberation
5. Open liberation again
6. load the saved file
7. Click on the AA Ground Object again -> Exception

**Expected behavior**
No Exception

**Additional information**
[test-V4-AA-T00.zip](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/6686141/test-V4-AA-T00.zip)

**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - develop on commit https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/commit/47e038c9fac61f0d04924dc1f2ea19b52de89c46

Unable to write DCS Liberation state to [nil]
then i goes on to tell me how to fix the issue but i am at a lost for what it is telling me. I admit, I am a novice when it comes to this. Can some on please help me out with a roadmap to make the requested repairs.

R,

K

title: Some Squadron Liveries do not Work
body:
Some liveries i cannot get to work via Liberation. they work just fine when selecting via either mission editor or by rearming. however, while most ones seem to work just fine, i cannot figure out what the problem might be with those not showing up. they spawn with standard livery (first in the list).
i spent quite a lot of time trying to fix this e.g. by renaming inside the description.lua of each livery not working, however this did not help either.

these are examples not working for no reason:
https://www.digitalcombatsimulator.com/de/files/3303764/
https://www.digitalcombatsimulator.com/de/files/3302383/

but there are others, that are practically the same, done by the same author and those work just fine:
https://www.digitalcombatsimulator.com/de/files/3306957/

i could not spot the difference between these, that could potentially be causing this.

i hope you might have an idea why some planes show up with the standard livery and some do show up just as intended. since the skins seem to work fine without liberation i assume the problem might be with liberation. 
i could just change the skin when i am in mission, however, this obviously only works for my own plane and in a scenario not involving the US, this can be a real bummer. only way right now is to avoid these liveries.

title: [Build 1971] AI Purchaser/Planner will not Utilize CVN and LHA
body:
**Describe the bug**
The Ai planner will not purchase aircraft for the CVN and LHA even if it has the money to do so. Further, even if the player manually purchases units there, the AI tasker will not generate any flights from the CVN and LHA.



**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Generate a campaign
2. set max starting budget and auto-purchase on
3. Note how no units are purchased at the CVN and LHA
4. Optionally, manually purchase units on the carriers
5. Pass Turn 0 into Turn 1
6. Note that even when manually purchased, carrier aircraft receive no taskings

**Expected behavior**
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.

**Additional information**

This behavior is especially obvious on the Battle for the UAE campaign where the player only starts with a single land base and the two carriers. Even at the default budget, you can see that Liwa AB will fill up and there will be leftover budget.

I believe this might also be the contributing factor to #1259 as the AWACS are probably at the bottom of the purchasing priority list so there isn't enough space at Liwa for the AI to purchase it. This could also be related to #1258?

**Additional context**
Illustrative save attached here:

[Build 1971 AI Purchaser Bug.zip](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/6678558/Build.1971.AI.Purchaser.Bug.zip)

title: Unable to add an EWR 'other ground object' target to an existing flight.
body:
Before filing, please search the issue tracker to see if the issue has already been reported.

If reporting a DCS AI bug, check https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation#dcs-bugs.

**Describe the bug**
The EWR ground objects don't show up in the waypoint dropdown list to add them to an existing flight. Like you can still click em and add flight, but can't add them to a flight if the flight was created for a different target - like you set a SEAD flight for some SAM location, but on the way, you wanna hit that EWR you'd have to start with EWR object, then add the SAM to that flight.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Create a flight for anything on the map, for fun an OCA. If you have an 'other ground object' like an EWR you wanna also hit, figure out its code name (?), and try to find it in the list where you edit your waypoints and add new waypoint - simply it won't be in the list. 

**Expected behavior**
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.
The EWR ground object should show up in the list with the ability to add the target to the flight.

**Additional information**

We will usually need more information for debugging. Include as much of the following as you are able:

- DCS Liberation save file (the `.liberation` file you save from the DCS Liberation window). By default these are located in your DCS saved games directory (`%USERPROFILE%/Saved Games/DCS`).

[01 - USA 2005 vs Russia 2010 - Inversed - Cacassus Full.zip](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/6674720/01.-.USA.2005.vs.Russia.2010.-.Inversed.-.Cacassus.Full.zip)

There's an EWR site to the east of Krasnodar-Center, its animal name is [CHICKEN]. I think it only is happening to these EWR sites as the [HAWK] ammo things show up in the list.


**Version information (please complete the following information):**

title: "RuntimeError: Duplicate convoy unit: Convoy 001 Unit #1"
body:
**Describe the bug**
Whenever I click 'take off' in this save game I get this error 

_RuntimeError: Duplicate convoy unit: Convoy 001 Unit #1_

![](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/782361390954053643/855186704352280607/unknown.png)

I haven't done any modifications to liberation or my game. I think the error has to do with a unit transfer. 

**To Reproduce**
I couldn't find a way to reproduce this bug, even when starting a new campaign and doing unit transfers. A discord mod told me to upload my save file: 

https://www.filemail.com/d/duursgepgprznae

**Expected behavior**

For the Take Off button to work and create a nextturn mission and new window for that, 

**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - DCS Liberation 3.0

title: Skynet Plugin does not add EWRs (because lower case ewr in unit name)
body:
**Describe the bug**
The skynet plugin only adds EWRs which have the "|EWR|" string in their name. In the current version there are some EWRs which only have "|ewr|" (lower case) in the name and they will not be added. (See screenshot of a newly created campaign turn which i openend with the mission editor)

I tracked this to the following pull: https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/pull/967
With commit https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/pull/967/commits/a35e6e31a95a7077a63510264ea705cfb9491a1d it was solved in the file ` game/theater/theatergroundobject.py`.
But the commit https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/commit/4e3766603749de45e2b2d969c0dff68c462b3f29#diff-951d5db3f24d6aa8455c5f0b58a4e9c17d89bfee67739efa47aa7a1fc4aa1da6 reverted these changes

A simple (temporary) workaround is to add the following line to `resources/plugins/skynetiads/skynetiads-config.lua`:

`iads:addEarlyWarningRadarsByPrefix(coalitionPrefix .. "|ewr|")` after line 69

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create a new campaign (for example: Syria - Battle for Golan Heights)
2. Pass Turn and Take Off
3. Open `liberation_nextturn.miz` with mission editor
4. Lookup the RED EWRs and check the unit names

**Expected behavior**
All EWRs have the unit name `*|EWR|*` in upper case so that Skynet can add them to the list

**Additional information**

This was already mentionend in this pull request: https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/pull/967

**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - DCS Liberation 3.0

**Additional context**
![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6678803/122417556-da9b1d80-cf89-11eb-9271-b376c70e81aa.png)

title: Bug since DCS 2.7.2.7910.1
body:
**Describe the bug**
"Player" aircraft are set as AI aircraft in ME since DCS 2.7.2.7910.1 Open Beta

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create a turn in Liberation with a player flight
2. Check ME. The player aircraft shows as "Veteran", yet if you use the drop down, "Player" is highlighted in yellow
3. If not corrected, there are no player flights. Can be corrected in ME by actually selecting the player flight

**Additional information**

It's not clear if this is a quirk of the new DCS release or the way player flight assignments in Liberation are transferred to the new version .... but you should be aware of the issue in case changes are needed


**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - DCS Liberation 3.0

**Additional context**

title: Aircraft Missing EPLRS(on) Waypoint Action
body:
**Describe the bug**

At least as of build #1936, all aircraft are missing the "EPLRS(on)" waypoint action. This action is typically added at the first waypoint (under "Perform Command" in the ME). It joins the aircraft to the data link network.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Generate a mission using build #1936
2. Confirm no aircraft have "EPLRS(on)" actions in the ME
3. In the game, no friendly aircraft are visible in the SA display (in, for e.g. the Hornet), whether or not there is an AWACS

**Expected behavior**
All aircraft need to have Perform Command > EPLRS(on) as one of their first waypoint actions for datalink functionality,

**Additional information**

We will usually need more information for debugging. Include as much of the following as you are able:


**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - DCS Liberation [e.g. 2.3.1]: Build #1936

[Current.00.liberation.zip](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/6662301/Current.00.liberation.zip)
[liberation_nextturn.zip](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/6662304/liberation_nextturn.zip)

title: Liberation 3.0 can't generate inverted Normandy campaign
body:
**Describe the bug**
Trying to generate a Normandy campaign with the "invert map" option in order to play as Germans will fail with the "Incompatible Save game" message, despite no save game existing.


**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Start new Normandy campaign, check invert map, select e.g. summer 1944 period
2. Select player faction = Germany 1944 and Enemy faction = Allies 1944
3. Continue to select No Carriers, No LHAs, No player navy, No enemy navy etc in campaign options (doesn't matter)
4. On clicking Finish, the frontlines are shown on the map but the "incompatible save game" popup appears. When clicking Ok, all units disappear from map again.

**Expected behavior**
Normandy campaign can be played as Germans with inverted map.

**Additional information**
- The error only occurs if using the "invert map" option on Normandy
- The exact same time period/faction/option settings work with "invert map" on e.g. Caucasus and Syria.
- Python console log 'liberation3.txt' attached.
- Error message popup 'liberation3.png' attached.

[liberation3.txt](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/6644632/liberation3.txt)
![liberation3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48153528/121821576-2bfd9100-cc9a-11eb-85cc-78f27b981e1c.png)

**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - DCS Liberation Open Beta 2.7.1.7139

**Additional context**

title: AI will not buy aircraft correctly if faction is missing a CAP capable aircraft
body:
Before filing, please search the issue tracker to see if the issue has already been reported.

If reporting a DCS AI bug, check https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation#dcs-bugs.

**Describe the bug**
Basically what the title says, if you have a faction that does not have a CAP capable aircraft then it will only buy a few aircraft and just stop buying them, even if they have lots of money and spaces available. This is very similar to the Tank issue with buying vehicles. 

**To Reproduce**
Create a faction with any aircraft makeup as long as there isn't a CAP capable aircraft in the faction. I tried multiple configurations and while the exact number they buy might change the same thing happens. They will stop before they are full up on slots.

**Expected behavior**
AI factions should buy aircraft till slots are full and utilize them to their capability. Obviously there is a buying priority order and that should still be followed but we need exceptions for non-standard factions



**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - DCS Liberation 3.0 and build # 1932 (current when finding this bug)

**Additional context**
I think this is part of what is broken about helicopters also. DCS AI obviously has an issue with helo's also but since the factions won't buy them in any quantity its hard to test what might be the problem.

I left out log files as there really isn't anything to find, pretty sure there just needs to be an exception added in to the buying system to allow for no CAP planes.

title: AI ground purchasing system does not work if faction does not have a tank
body:
Before filing, please search the issue tracker to see if the issue has already been reported.

If reporting a DCS AI bug, check https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation#dcs-bugs.

**Describe the bug**
I tried this on multiple campaigns and factions, the AI will not purchase vehicles correctly if the faction does not have a Tank type vehicle. I will upload the 2 test factions I used, it is the standard PMC Russian faction and a copy with the T-55 added in. This happened with other non-tank factions this is just the testing bed I used to confirm the Bug

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1.   Load up any campaign with any blue faction. Use standard PMC - Russian faction. Don't worry about buying your vehicles, just click skip turn. You will see that every time they have bought the same 6 vehicles. You can check the enemy income intel and see they have extra money but won't use it. multiple skipped turns and nothing changes.
2.   Load up the same settings except use the faction provided which is exactly the same except the T-55 has been added. repeat procedure for skipping the first turn and you will see the enemy has bought multiple vehicles, and subsequent turns shows them spending more up the limits of the campaign.

**Expected behavior**
Either we need clear information of what vehicle classes MUST be in factions so they can be modified and fixed in an update or the enemy should be able to function without certain vehicles. 


**Uploaded files**
I am adding a clean log file with only the non-tank faction, creation of campaign, and the skipping of 4 turns.
No mission file was ever created, so there is nothing to upload from that.
Both Factions I used for testing are added as a txt documents since we can't upload json files here.

[liberation.log](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/6643094/liberation.log)
[pmc_russian.txt](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/6643096/pmc_russian.txt)
[pmc_russian_tank.txt](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/6643098/pmc_russian_tank.txt)


**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - DCS Liberation 3.0 release

**Additional context**
Faction customization is pushed heavily on the discord as a simple thing people can do to change their Liberation experience, we either need info added to the wiki explaining what vehicles are what type and which types must be needed and so on, or the system needs to work.

title: You can buy units at the Carrier
body: You can buy ground units at the carrier and the LHA

title: Cannot Progress: Liberation 3.0 does not connect to DCS and creates no State.JSON

labels.name: not reproducible
labels.description: Closed because the developers cannot reproduce the issue to investigate. More info needed.

body:
Since 3.0, Liberation does not seem to recognize or connect to my ingame progress and also does not create a state.json file in its directory that i could use to manually progress the campaign. the window saying "waiting for mission completion" stays as it is when you have not startet the mission yet. even after flying the mission, it's still the same, leaving me only with the option to abort mission or manually submit results, which would require a state.json.
it is a new and compatible campaign, everything set pretty much as standard, only changed income multipliers, factions & date and activated most of the scripts available. 

(the mission itself worked out flawlessly)

never had this problem before, hope theres an easy fix or workaround :)

title: Mission script error upon loading on dedi
body:
I started a new campaign with 3.0

I host the mission on a dedi so I opened it in ME, saved it, and started the server up.
Upon loading the mission, the dedi comes up with a string error:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29724443/121775056-940e8300-cb85-11eb-9485-4c683231c577.png)

title: Cull zone overlay prevents creating missions on front lines
body:
Couldn't see this reported yet.
Enabling the culling zone overlay prevents mission creation on front lines.

To reproduce:
1.  Go to settings and enable cull zones.
2. Set cull zones to cover front lines.
3. Attempt to create a mission on the front lines.

Right clicking to create the mission will only bring up the page refresh menu.

In 2.5.1 and before, the expected behavior was that a menu would pop up so that you could create a mission.  With the overlay disabled, this behaves as expected.

We will usually need more information for debugging. Include as much of the following as you are able:

Version 3.0. 

Thanks guys, loving the new UI otherwise!

title: A-4E Custom Squadrons break campaign generation
body:
Creating a custom squadron .yam file for the A-4E-C in Saved Games/DCS/Liberation/Squadrons appears to break campaign generation; Clicking the finish button will not generate anything. 

Custom squadron .yam files for other aircraft work fine. It's just the A-4E-C. I suspect it might have something to do with the A-4 liveries not being in the Saved Games/Liveries directory like all other liveries are.

`---
name: VMA-211
nickname: Avengers
country: USA
role: Strike Fighter
aircraft: A_4E_C
livery: USMC VMA-211 Avengers
mission_types:

title: Unit purchase "+" button is greyed out if purchase fails due to insufficient funds, but does not revert back to green if funds are made available elsewhere
body:
**Describe the bug**
If I buy, for example, F-15Cs till I run out of money, the "+" button is greyed out. However, if I free up some money by reducing purchases of other units, the "+" button stays grey until I press "-". This is a problem if you click on "+" for a unit that you have a current count of 0 when you have no money. Because it greys out the "+" button. But since you can't press "-" (as you have 0), you can no longer buy units of that type even when you free up money for it.

#1900 preview

title: Repeated mission plays causes JTAC Kneeboard entry to accumulate
body:
**Describe the bug**
Repeated mission generations through DCS Liberation causes the Kneeboard's JTAC field to grow longer and longer, even if there is only one JTAC in the mission.

**To Reproduce**
1.  Create a mission that contains a player JTAC.
2.  Generate the mission.
3.  See one JTAC entry for each front line
3.  Abort Mission
4.  Generate the same mission again.
5.  See two JTAC entries for each front line.
6.  Abort Mission
7.  Generate the same mission again.
8.  See three JTAC entries for each front line

**Expected behavior**
Regardless of number of generated mission attempts, the number of JTAC entries to match the number of JTACs for the player.

**Additional information**
Campaign and mission.
[RepeatingJTAC.zip](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/6613462/RepeatingJTAC.zip)


**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - DCS Liberation Build 1829

**Additional context**

title: Automate Aircraft/Frontline purchases uses campaign generation choice rather than settings choice on Turn 0
body:
If reporting a DCS AI bug, check https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation#dcs-bugs.

**Describe the bug**
So it looks like if you don't select Automate frontline/aircraft purchases at campaign generation but then go into settings and turn them on during turn 0, it doesn't use autogen for turn 0 to turn 1, but only on the turn 1 to turn 2. Likewise, if you select automate purchases at campaign generation and then turn it off in settings straight afterwards, it will still automate air/ground purchases on turn 0 to turn 1.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Don't select automated unit purchase when starting new campaign
2. Turn those on afterwards in Settings
3. Pass Turn
4. Automated unit purchase doesn't occur until the next turn

**Expected behavior**
Should use whatever it's set to in the settings.

title: channel map - bombers auto-assigned to runways that are too short.
body:
Before filing, please search the issue tracker to see if the issue has already been reported.

If reporting a DCS AI bug, check https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation#dcs-bugs.

**Describe the bug**
Bomber planes assigned to airports where the runways are too short to support takeoff. 
Examples: 
1. Ju88 taking off from Saint Omer Longuenesse. 
2. A-20G taking off from Dunkirk Mardyck

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Start new campaign for the channel map using "operation dynamo". 
2. In the screen for difficulty and automation options tick the boxes for automate runway repairs, automate frontline purchases and automate aircraft purchases. 
3. Finish and launch the campaign. 
4. Select "pass turn". 
5. Select "take off" and go into DCS mission editor.
6. You can either see it here or run the mission to see how bombers are trying to take off from runways that are too short. 

**Expected behavior**
I was hoping bombers would only be able to be assigned to places where the runway is long enough. 

**Additional information**
I can provide a mission if it helps but i think it should be very easy/fast to reproduce this issue.

title: Loadout defaults back to Liberation CAS if you select custom loadout, close window, re-open window, and unselect custom loadout
body:
**Describe the bug**
If you say, set up a DEAD flight and click Use Custom Loadout, close the Edit Flight window, then re-open it, the selected loadout changes to Liberation CAS (instead of the original default of Liberation DEAD). The loadout is still your custom loadout. But if you then want to switch back to the default by de-selecting the Use Custom Loadout checkbox, it switches you back to the CAS loadout instead of DEAD. This seems to happen no matter what loadout you pick (I tried DEAD, SEAD, and BAI). It always switches you back to the Liberation CAS loadout.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Set up a package, e.g. DEAD (basically anything other than CAS)
2. You'll see selected loadout is Liberation DEAD
3. Click Use custom loadout
4. Close Edit Flight window (there is no need to close the mission package window)
5. Open Edit Flight window once again.
6. You'll see the selected loadout is Liberation CAS
7. Unselect Use custom loadout
8. The Liberation CAS loadout will be loaded, rather than the original Liberation DEAD

**Version information (please complete the following information):**
#1694

title: [Build 1703] Logistics System/Convoy Bug with Unreachable Frontlines
body:
In this campaign that I am testing, I have two frontlines that are only connected via a blue CP and a factory on just one side of the fork. When I try to pass a turn where a convoy is created, I get the error shown below. 

I think that the factory in one fork is trying to send reinforcements to the frontline in the other fork but it can't find a valid path to it since the only path is through the blue CPs.

I found this one by accident as I forgot to add a factory to the other fork but I think that the intended behavior for this is that if there is no viable path from a factory to a frontline it just does not try to reinforce that frontline.

To reproduce:
1. load save/generate campaign provided
2. set all procurement to automatic
3. attempt to pass turn

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/72566076/120008404-c5852d00-bf8f-11eb-81a0-64b347ec1014.png)

title: TARCAP cannot be planned over FOBs
body:
**Describe the bug**
Not curerntly able to plan TARCAPs over FOBs.

**Expected behavior**
FOBs should allow TARCAPs

title: Base - Base Defenses tab unpopulated
body:
**Describe the bug**
Within the friendly Base dialog, the Base Defenses tab is unpopulated.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create a new campaign
2. Click on any friendly base
3. Click Base Defenses tab - empty

**Expected behavior**
Expect to see base defenses automatically populated and able to be added/replaced/removed like in 2.x

**Additional information**
Included images for 2.x and 3.0 build 1652.  Included Lib and Miz files from 3.0 build 1652

![Screenshot 2021-05-26 134445](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17415205/119707998-cd2ac180-be29-11eb-8324-f7b0306488fe.jpg)

![Screenshot 2021-05-26 135014](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17415205/119708017-d320a280-be29-11eb-99fa-05c16ae93738.jpg)

Liberation and Mission Files:
[3-1652.zip](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/6548720/3-1652.zip)


**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - DCS Liberation [e.g. 2.3.1]: 3.0 build 1652

**Additional context**
Maybe this is being phased out?  I did searches for 'defense', 'defenses' and 'base defenses' before submitting.

title: Remove North Caucasus Campaign from the List
body: This campaign is still using the old, non-miz format and is totally deprecated so it should be removed from the campaigns list.

title: STRIKE objective map markers only generate 1 in-game marker regardless of number of buildings
body:
**Describe the bug**
Objective markers on the map do not include every building designated for a map scenery object strike objective.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1) start a new campaign with scenery objectives on a build that supports the feature
2) get to turn 1 and boot up DCS
3) observe that the scenery objective map marker is only located where the icon is located on the Liberation campaign map

**Expected behavior**
map markers for every building in the designated objective

This is the current result in every build up to 1664:

![bugpic1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55866858/119609543-c702f980-bdc5-11eb-8518-f88f6906abef.jpg)
![bugpic2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55866858/119609555-c9655380-bdc5-11eb-8602-24d78c154d64.jpg)

title: Sweeps and Escorts set to ignore multi-role fighters
body:
**Describe the bug**
Sweep and Escorts have their advanced waypoint action "search then engage" set to engage only fighters, ignoring all other aircraft types. With the majority of aircraft being multirole fighters, this means that the Sweeps and Escorts hardly engage anything, and any multirole fighter (P-47, Fw190A8) can fly with near impunity. 

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create Sweep or Escort flight
2. Check advanced waypoint action "search then engage"
3. See error

**Expected behavior**
Sweep and Escort should be set to engage both fighters and multirole fighters, as there are few purebred fighters in DCS, and the majority of aircraft in the AO are multirole.

**Additional information**
Most noticeable in WW2; unsure if it also affects modern campaigns.

**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - DCS Liberation 2.5
[WW2_Liberation_Bugs.zip](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/6543633/WW2_Liberation_Bugs.zip)

title: WW2: DEAD, BAI Advanced Waypoint Actions - Guided munitions
body:
**Describe the bug**
WW2 aircraft set to CAS in DCS (from DEAD or BAI in Liberation) will have their advanced waypoint action "attack group" set to employ guided munitions. Guided munitions do not exist in DCS WW2, and the group RTB's at their ingress point, failing to hit their target.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Task an aircraft with DEAD or BAI
2. Check aircraft's advanced waypoint action on their ingress waypoint
3. Open the advanced waypoint action "attack group"
4. See error

**Expected behavior**
I assume Liberation needs a one-size-fits-all approach to generating waypoints and advanced waypoint actions for both WW2 and modern aircraft. I believe in past iterations the advanced waypoint action was set to auto. 

**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - DCS Liberation 2.5

[WW2_Liberation_Bugs.zip](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/6543606/WW2_Liberation_Bugs.zip)

title: A20 and B17 no default payloads
body:
**Describe the bug**
A20 and B17 in all ground attack tasks are spawned empty

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Task A20 or B17 with OCA runway strike, strike, or DEAD
2. Check payload
3. Confirm payload is empty

**Expected behavior**
Default payloads are present for most aircraft, and had been present on A20s and B17s in previous iterations.

**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - DCS Liberation 2.5
[WW2_Liberation_Bugs.zip](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/6543588/WW2_Liberation_Bugs.zip)

title: No Flight Plans Rendered Over Map for Syria
body:
When using the Syria map theatre the flight plan lines don't appear over the map for the develop branch preview build. 
Other maps seems to work ok (Nevada, PG etc) so this just seems just Syria map related.

If I hit 'Reload' from the right mouse button on the Map then they will appear with default options.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create a new campaign - Syria - Inherent Resolve
2. Choose Auto Purchase options.
3. Pass Turn to move from turn 0
4. Don't see any flight plans on map, or have the ability to select flights for display on map from list.

**Expected behavior**
Other maps show flight plan lines correctly, so was expecting that on Syria map as well.

**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - DCS Liberation 3.0 - 1657 preview

[liberation.log](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/6542886/liberation.log)

title: [Build 1652] ASAP AEW&C Missions do not actually ASAP
body:
The default AEW&C missions do not actually ASAP their ToTs even when the ASAP box is checked as shown below. Tested with a couple different 3.0 compatible campaigns with the same results.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/72566076/119568957-f896a900-bd62-11eb-8053-b14a5bcbdbb7.png)

title: Bandar Abbas Intl Kneeboard ILS Frequency does not match F10 Map
body:
**Describe the bug**
F10 map shows Bandar Abbas Intl with runway 21 with ILS as `109.90 (IBND)`.  Kneeboard shows ILS frequency as `333.80`.

**To Reproduce**
1)  Create modern campaign with Persain Gulf and Bandar Abbas as friendly airbase.
2)  Start flight at Bandar Abbas Intl

**Expected behavior**
Runway 21 ILS to be `109.90`

**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - DCS Liberation Build 1635

**Additional context**

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74509817/119436832-31d70680-bcda-11eb-9fbd-3dc1b592bbdf.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74509817/119436868-40252280-bcda-11eb-8671-1ca2fc829721.png)

title: getting Index Error when Take-off clicked.
body:
Before filing, please search the issue tracker to see if this feature has already been requested.


**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I mentioned in the Discord server that it was mentioned in BR 641 that cause index errors was due to selling assets opfor was planning against, is it possible that index errors could be cause for bluefor assets as well?

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Before advancing to next day, you could plan out your missions the day before? Just update the opfors mission when you click next day. I don't know about the BTS, but from my *extremely limited* knowledge i Think this makes sense?

**Additional context**
Index error from my last mission . Keep up the great work guys i appreciate the fact that you guys created such an amazing tool that really shouldve been implemented in the game. KUTGW

title: radar detection still wrong
body:
https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/commit/f68935735d436385a0821e1168a8726c7dba8ebb attempted to improve detection of SAMs that have active radars, but it's still wrong (and the UI has been for ages). Non-radar units still have `detection_range` set, so we can't use that as a key for detecting whether or not a SAM has a radar.

I think we probably do need to go back to the curated list, but we need to audit the list since it was missing so many things and included things it should not have.

title: DEAD flight with B52 or F117 does not create attack task in mission editor
body:
Related discussion: #774

When creating a DEAD flight with either B-52s or F-117s, their flight routes are created without an attack task as can be seen in the mission editor in DCS. As a result, these flights will never attack their target and move from ingress to egress immediately.

**Steps to reproduce:**

1. Create game and choose faction with B-52s or F-117s+
2. Buy B-52s or F-117s 
3. Pass turn
4. Plan DEAD flight with B-52 or F-117 on any enemy air defence group
5. TAKE OFF
6. Open mission in mission editor and see created flight's waypoints

**Expected behavior**
Task to attack the predefined group in the ingress waypoint's advanced waypoint options.

**Additional information**

[DEAD_B52_F117_NOACTIONS.zip](https://github.com/dcs-liberation/dcs_liberation/files/6490208/DEAD_B52_F117_NOACTIONS.zip)
![F117NOACTIONS](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29946458/118415579-667c0a00-b6ab-11eb-9731-2c9dfa43a873.png)

**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - DCS Liberation 2.5.1

**Additional context**
My guess is that this happens with all aircraft that are not capable of the SEAD task as per mission editor in DCS as they do not have dedicated anti-radiation weapons. Instead, the 'pinpoint strike' task is chosen, but no target is created. In my opinion, the easiest way to fix this is to remove the SEAD and DEAD roles from these aircraft and have them execute these types of flights with 'Strike' as default.

title: Special character 'Ş' or 'ş' breaks state.json reading
body:
Give a flight a custom name that includes the letter Ş or ş or both. This character exists in Romanian and Turkish alphabets. We had a flight with a custom name called "Şimşek". The mission had no problem, the state.json file was saved correctly with that letter. Reading the state.json file was giving an error. The results did not show up. Then I checked the error log from the terminal. The problem was with Ş character. Then I opened the state.json, changed the letter to S, then manually submit the state.json file. Everything worked fine.

You may want to add extra support for special characters in state.json reader. ISO/IEC 8859-9 is the standard I guess.

title: AI Strike on Factory only target one building
body:
When setting up an AI strike flight on an enemy target, only the first building gets hit. For example the factory which features 4 buildings, only one building (main) will be hit, the remaining 3 are not targeted.

I tried with F-16s and F-15Es, both with standard loadout or custom (LGBs, Mavericks...). In all cases, AI does not engage the remaining building.

Those missions are therefore quite useless: 4x 10M$ for a factory, if they only destroy 1 building it is still generating 30M$ per turn after the strike.

On the next turn, a new strike will still hit the first (destroyed) building. The are still not attacking the other 3 buildings.

If I assign the strike to a player flight, I do get 4 waypoints (one of each building). My wingman will behave it the same way as other AI and only engage the main building, regardless if it is damaged/destroyed or not.

AI strike flights on a building group (like factory, petrol tanks...) should try and destroy all buildings. At least for the factory, this is not happening right now (2.7.0.5118).

T+00:36:33 - T+00:40:00

Observed Flights:
- F18 PHEASANT DEAD|2|3|25
- F18 PHESANT DEAD|2|4|25

We will usually need more information for debugging. Include as much of the following as you are able:

- DCS Liberation save file (the `.liberation` file you save from the DCS Liberation window). By default these are located in your DCS saved games directory (`%USERPROFILE%/Saved Games/DCS`).
- The generated mission file (the `.miz` file that you load in DCS to play the turn). By default these are located in your missions directory (`%USERPROFILE%/Saved Games/DCS/Missions`).
- A tacview track file, especially when demonstrating an issue with AI behavior. By default these are located in your Tacview tracks directory (`%USERPROFILE%/Documents/Tacview`).
- The state.json file from the finished mission when the problem is related to results processing. By default these are located in your Liberation install directory.

**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - DCS Liberation v2.5
[liberation AI crash.zip](https://github.com/Khopa/dcs_liberation/files/6402503/liberation.AI.crash.zip)

title: [Build 1459] Naval Strike Targets Attached to Carriers/LHAs not Generating
body:
**Describe the bug**

Naval strike targets are not generating when they are associated with a Carrier or LHA. Naval targets that are attached to land-based CPs, however, will generate as expected.

**To Reproduce**

Pick any up-to-date campaign, verify in the ME that a CJTF Blue Arleigh Burke is placed next to a carrier, generate that campaign and note that there are no strike targets spawned near the carriers.

**Expected behavior**
Placing a CJTF Blue Arleigh Burke in the campaign miz should generate naval strike targets when associated with carrier CPs.

title: AMRAAMs being assinged on "None" pylons on F-15C
body:
Trying with weapons restricted by date on, in 1984 campaign, the loadout on the F-15C has "None" for points 3 and 9. However, in the actual mission AIM-120Cs are on both points. Oddest part I think is missiles being put on the points that were set to None in the flight editor.Before filing, please search the issue tracker to see if the issue has already been reported.

**To Reproduce**
(Unsure if all steps are needed)
Have a campaign with weapons restricted by date and in a pre-AMRAAM campaign date:
Purchase and have available F-15C to assign a flight
Set up F-15C flight of any A2A type. Default loadout has pylons 3 and 9 listed as "None"
Go into DCS
Check F-15C flight loadout (Flying the plane or view in mission editor)
Pylons 3 and 9 will have AIM-120C loaded on them

**Expected behavior**
Would expect pylons 3 and 9 to be empty as listed in the Liberation flight editor 

**Additional information**


[F-15C loadout error.zip](https://github.com/Khopa/dcs_liberation/files/6381736/F-15C.loadout.error.zip)

[liberation_nextturn.zip](https://github.com/Khopa/dcs_liberation/files/6381744/liberation_nextturn.zip)

title: Exclusion zones lag behind 1 turn
body:
**Describe the bug**
When creating mission no exclusion zone is created. However, once you pass a turn or finish the mission exclusion zone is created for the next turn even if the area does not anymore have a mission.


**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Plan a mission to the area that is not currently excluded
2. Hit take off
3. Notice on mission editor that the target is not created for the mission
4. Finish the mission
5. Observe exclusion zone appearing where the mission was on last turn


**Expected behavior**
Exclusion zone is created for the turn you have the mission, not turn after that.

**Additional information**

Screenshots and discussion about this issue here: 

https://discord.com/channels/595702951800995872/595706079459934208/835839586537963530
[bugtestsyriaka50.zip](https://github.com/Khopa/dcs_liberation/files/6371818/bugtestsyriaka50.zip)




- DCS Liberation save file 
[bugtestsyriaka50.zip](https://github.com/Khopa/dcs_liberation/files/6371818/bugtestsyriaka50.zip)



- The generated mission file 

[liberation_nextturn.zip](https://github.com/Khopa/dcs_liberation/files/6371820/liberation_nextturn.zip)


**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - DCS Liberation 2.6.1407

**Additional context**

Edit: I found a workaround for this bug. Going to the setting and disabling culling and then enabling it back creates proper exclusion zones and removes wrong ones.

title: Purchase from airfield allows negative budget
body:
**Describe the bug**
The available budget does not actually limit the player from buying vehicles and aircraft from airfields.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Open an airfield
2. Purchase units until you don't have enough budget left to continue buying
3. Buy more anyway
4. Budget will go negative
5. Pass Turn or Take Off will still allow mission to be flown.

**Expected behavior**
Available budget should limit the player's purchases.

**Additional information**

N/A

**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - Version 3.0 preview build 1445

title: Catapult issue
body: I was using the DCS Liberation just now. I noticed something. I don't know if it's a Liberation issue or a DCS issue. If you have more than 1 Tomcat in the same flight they won't both setup on CAT 1 and 2 at the same time. The first one will setup on Cat 1. The second one will park behind Cat 2 and wait until the first one launches before he approaches the second cat and hooks up. Aircraft should be able to setup and hook up to Cat 1 and Cat 2 at the same time. I am currently using 2.5. The F-14s could hook up to Cat 1 and Cat 2 at the same time in 2.4. Again unsure if it maybe a DCS issue or not

body:
Clicking the Transfer button in the misc section of the info bar does not open a window and generates the error shown in the pic below:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/72566076/115603261-cb9f3400-a294-11eb-9553-3006d09d7f90.png)


This occurs at Turn 0 and Turn 1 after units have already been purchased. From Turn 2 and onwards, the menu does seem to work and you can see that units are transferring. We infer from this that the menu will not open when there are no transfers actively occurring.

title: can cancel enemy unit transfers
body:
The pending transfers window currently shows both friendly and enemy transfers, and the player can cancel either.

The model currently mixes player and enemy transfers in the same list and the UI index and the index of the actual data in the game are expected to match, so the fix is more complicated than simply filtering out the enemy transfer orders.

title: Custom dates non-functional, campaign reverts to selected preset
body:
Before filing, please search the issue tracker to see if the issue has already been reported.

**Describe the bug**
Attempting to select a custom date after unticking "use preset date" in the new game wizard results in the campaign using the preset date anyway.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Start new campaign wizard
2. Untick "use preset" in time period section.
3. Use arrows to increment starting date to September.
4. Complete wizard with all default options.
5. Observe that campaign reverts to June 1995 instead of custom date.

**Expected behavior**
for the campaign to use selected custom date

**Additional information**

Build 1384. Bug is **_not_** 100% consistent, but seems to be occur most frequently when using the Mid-90s Summer preset, which is the default starting one.

title: Anti Ship strike missing a target waypoint.
body:
Before filing, please search the issue tracker to see if the issue has already been reported.

**Describe the bug**
Created a large formation of F18's set for anti ship operation. They Took off, flew to the ingress point, then went to the egress point and landed no anti shipping was done.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
I have had one successful anti shipping strike, but it was at the start of a new game.

I think this is based on the fact that it seems to redirect my anti ship strike to a second group when I plan to attack the Admiral Kuznetov. 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10494948/112789001-15945180-902a-11eb-9f6b-71e4394948b9.png)

Here is the first time it happened, it shows the missing target point more clearly.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10494948/112789172-7cb20600-902a-11eb-95a8-ba8090ccb053.png)

**Expected behavior**
Add  Admiral Kuznetov as a target at waypoint 4.

**Additional information**
Note that the F16 escort in the same package was given the ship coordinates as a flyover point.

Here is the liberation file and the mission file.

title: transfer aircraft out of captured bases
body:
**Before filing, please search the issue tracker to see if the issue has already been reported**
see #693

**Describe the bug**
capturing a base, where the opponent has most of its air assets can basically break OPFOR. despite the fact that there would be space available on other AB in range, air assets are currently not transferred before a base is taken, and thereafter registered as lost. the campagin goes on, but without real air resistance.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. start invasion of iran lite as bluefor modern
2. wait for shiraz to be filled with dozens of a/c by redfor
3. capture shiraz
4. See error: all air assets from shiraz are lost, although kerman has plenty of parking space left

**Expected behavior**
simple: after base capture (runtime), air assets are transferred to the closest AB with available parking slots until filled up. then to the next closest AB, a.s.o. (assuming the evacuation process had taken place before the actual capture during turn; assuming a well organized evacuation where distance is no factor thanks to AAR)

more elaborate: define a radius (tbd) around any base that, if crossed by a number (tbd) of OPFOR ground forces, will trigger transfer of air assets. player would be able to see this during runtime.

**Additional information**
We will usually need more information for debugging. Include as much of the following as you are able:
- DCS Liberation save file: attached
- The generated mission file: attached, but the one after the turn (shiraz already taken)
- A tacview track file: attached
- The state.json file from the finished mission: attached

**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - DCS Liberation 2.4.3-2

**Additional context**
N/A

title: Aircraft at airport does not match number of aircraft reported by intel at Tonopah Test Range Airfield
body:
**Describe the bug**
The Liberation campaign reports 36 aircraft at Tonopah Test Range Airfield, however upon inspection of the mission file, a total of 14 aircraft (8 on ground, 6 air starts) are found.  This makes OCA/Aircraft strikes considerably less effective.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1.  Generate 1995 era, Nevada "Exercise Vegas Nerve" campaign (USA 2005 vs Russia 1990).  Weapon Restrictions on.
2. Play the campaign a couple of turns for Russia to build up their forces.
3. Observe the difference between number of aircraft reported, and number that actually exists.

**Expected behavior**

The number of aircraft reported by the Liberation campaign should match the number of aircraft starting from that airfield.

**Additional information**

Campaign and Mission:
[Tonopah_Wrong_Aircraft_Count.zip](https://github.com/Khopa/dcs_liberation/files/6088037/Tonopah_Wrong_Aircraft_Count.zip)

 - DCS Liberation 2.4.2

title: "Search then engage" conditions interfere with AI engagement
body:
Redirected from Discord. 

Search then engage (in zone) and similar advanced waypoint actions have conditions set to "fighters" only. After having a multitude of issues with my AI wingmen and AI patrols/sweeps not engaging enemy aircraft, I did some digging into this setting and, upon changing it to allow engagment of all aircraft, the AI wingman, patrols, and sweeps engaged normally. 

In my current campaign the majority of bandits are Fw190 A-8s, so it looks like whatever database used by the AI does not classify the A-8 as a "fighter," thus they never engaged.

title: AI does not fill front lines with ground units even if they have money
body:
**Describe the bug**
AI even when they have money, in this case 2000 million, AI does not fill front line with ground units. This might be more of an feature request than bug report depending on what behaviour devs have intented. After a turn where you destroy most, or all AI ground units on the next turn AI only has few units on the frontline even if they had more than enough money to fill the front line.

**To Reproduce**
Play a turn. Plan some CAS missions to destroy enemy ground units. Finish the mission.
Observe that even if the AI has money they have not filled front line with new units.


**Expected behavior**
If AI has resources, AI should utilize them by always having units in the frontline.

**Additional information**
AI front line purchases are governed by same rules as players so there is not buffer for ground units where AI could pull units to frontline every turn even if they had resources to do it.

Suggestion: Allow AI to pull more units from FOBs connected to frontline and make sure AI purchases FOBs full of units (30 units)for FOObs that are not active on frontline so if AI has money they can always fill the frontline with new units.

We will usually need more information for debugging. Include as much of the following as you are able:


Liberation file
[frontlineunits.zip](https://github.com/Khopa/dcs_liberation/files/6057812/frontlineunits.zip)



**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - DCS Liberation 2.5.-1201-preview:

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

title: F-117As only attack SAMs when set as Strike mission
body:
**Describe the bug**
Assigning F117As to attack a SAM site in SEAD or DEAD will cause the flight to not attack the SAM.  Skynet on/off does not appear to change the result.

When flight is DEAD, flight will turn direct from ingress to egress.
When flight is SEAD, flight will overfly SAM but not attack.

**To Reproduce**
1)  Generate Campaign with player faction USA 2005, enemy faction: Iran 1988
    - Maximize player income
    - Minimize opposition faction starting money and income for ease of testing
2)  Buy lots of F117As
3)  Pass time until night
4)  Generate SEAD, DEAD, Strike F-117A flights on different SAMs (Like one SAM site gets a DEAD flight, one SAM site gets a SEAD flight, one SAM gets a Strike flight)
5)  Observe
    - DEAD flight will turn direct from Ingress to Egress waypoint, bomb bay closed
    - SEAD flight will overfly SEAD waypoint, bomb bay closed
    - Strike opens bomb bay after passing Ingress, with all planes in the flight bombing WP1 on first pass then bombing WP2 on second pass.


**Expected behavior**
F117As to attack SAMs when configured as DEAD or SEAD flight.

**Additional information**

Campaign, Mission, Tacviews:

[F117a_SAM_attack_DEAD_NoSkynet.zip](https://github.com/Khopa/dcs_liberation/files/6057776/F117a_SAM_attack_DEAD_NoSkynet.zip)
[F117a_SAM_attack_SEAD_NoSkynet.zip](https://github.com/Khopa/dcs_liberation/files/6057778/F117a_SAM_attack_SEAD_NoSkynet.zip)
[F117a_SAM_attack_SEAD_Skynet.zip](https://github.com/Khopa/dcs_liberation/files/6057779/F117a_SAM_attack_SEAD_Skynet.zip)
[F117a_SAM_attack_Strike_Skynet.zip](https://github.com/Khopa/dcs_liberation/files/6057780/F117a_SAM_attack_Strike_Skynet.zip)

**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - DCS Liberation 2.4.2

**Additional context**
 - When Skynet is disabled, the SAMs detect the F117s a couple of miles away.  If the SAM is powerful enough it will fire before the flight overflies the SAM.
 - When Skynet is enabled, the SAMs aren't on, so only point defenses detect them when nearby.

title: B52s not performing DEAD with AGM-86Cs
body:
**Describe the bug**
B-52s are not deploying AGM-86Cs at the target (SA-10).  This happens both with Skynet enabled or disabled.  When the B52 reaches the Ingress point it turns directly towards the egress point.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1)  Generate "Nevada - Exercise Vegas Nerve" campaign.
    - USA 2005, Russia 1990,
    - No carriers/LHA
    - Start date: Mid-90s Summer [1995]
    - Culling of distant units enabled (100 km) + No cull around aircraft carriers
    - Restrict Weapons by date enabled
    - Jtac Autolase, Skynet (as desired)
    - All the money
    
2)  Create a DEAD mission on an SA-10 that is isolated (3 Tors + 2 SA-10 TRs) with the following
    
    - 4 ship DEAD F18 (1x Player, Runway Start)
    - 2 ship DEAD B-52 (Air Start)
    - 2 x 4 ship SEAD F18 (Air Start)
    - 2 x 4 ship ESCORT F16 (Air Start)

3)  Play the mission and watch the B52s.

**Expected behavior**
B-52s to launch ordinance at prescribed target.

**Additional information**
Campaign, Mission, Tacviews for Skynet + No Skynet:
[B52_Bailed_Skynet.zip](https://github.com/Khopa/dcs_liberation/files/6056294/B52_Bailed_Skynet.zip)
[B52_Bailed_NoSkynet.zip](https://github.com/Khopa/dcs_liberation/files/6056295/B52_Bailed_NoSkynet.zip)

Skynet + No Skynet Tracks:
[B52_Bailed_Tracks.zip](https://github.com/Khopa/dcs_liberation/files/6056298/B52_Bailed_Tracks.zip)

**Version information (please complete the following information):**

title: B-17G flightplan missing bombing triggers
body: B-17G tasked with SEAD through Liberation (Ground Attack in DCS) are given a waypoint over the target, but are missing the bombing triggers necessary for the B-17s to employ their bombs. Typically there is no waypoint over the target, with the IP waypoint tasked with an advanced action "Bombing", and the target triangle positioned over the desired target. To my knowledge, B-17s can't (or at least have difficulty with) attacking targets without the bombing advanced task set.

title: DCS Syria Map / A10 parking bug affecting Liberation mission starts

labels.name: dcs issue
labels.description: We think that this issue is a DCS World or a third party issue that cannot be resolved by us.

body:
When creating an A10 strike flight from King Hussein, I could not get the flight to cold start ... despite it being set in the flight parameters. It consistently starts in the air. Upon re-opening Liberation, it has become an "air start" flight. Save it as "cold start" and it reverts to an air start flight.

After some investigation, it seems that the Syria map / A10 parking is bugged in that the A10 only has a few parking spots showing that can be used. Other aircraft do not seem to be affected and have the full number of spots available. Thus if the number of A10 aircraft exceed this small number of parking spots, the flight will be converted by the mission editor into an "air start" flight above that air base. The route isn't affected - including arrival back at the same airbase.

With "automatic aircraft purchase" in operation, Liberation has purchased more A10 aircraft than can start from the ground - which is the cause of my problem.

It looks like this is a bug with the Syria Map. At Al Dumayr, for example, there are 57 parking slots available but only 4 can be used by the A10.

Obviously fixable by changing aircraft although auto purchasing could do with not buying any more A10's! I can free up a user space by creating an extra user flight that isn't flown. That seems to work.

title: Start Times for Carrier Aircraft Stay at 00:00:00 Regardless of TOT (and ASAP Gives TOT of 00:00:00)
body:
Before filing, please search the issue tracker to see if the issue has already been reported.

**Describe the bug**

Start Times for Carrier Aircraft Stay at 00:00:00 Regardless of TOT (and ASAP Gives TOT of 00:00:00). 

I had AI aircraft default to Runway Start, so presumably OCA/Aircraft is broken and is not expected to work. However, this issue also applies to OCA/Runway, which should not be affected? Furthermore, when adding flights from landbases, this issue is not there. Only affects carrier aircraft (and regardless of their start type).

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
0. Aircraft default to Runway Start
1. Create an Attack Airfield mission
2. Add any type of flight; SEAD, Escort, OCA/Airfield, etc. from a carrier.
3. See start times not affected by TOT (remain at 00:00:00) and ASAP rresults in TOT of 00:00:00.
4. Issue persists even if indivvidual flights change start type
5. Issue is not there when using land based aircraft

**Expected behavior**

Start times change based on TOT. ASAP gives reasonable TOT.

**Notes**

- Found same bug with carrier aircraft packages to frontlines (any mission)

**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - DCS Liberation [e.g. 2.3.1]: Preview Build 1114
![Capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26183/106379685-87218d80-6362-11eb-861b-8bf319f08662.PNG)
![Capture2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26183/106379686-87ba2400-6362-11eb-9347-1dd873a0d056.PNG)

title: B-17's don't respect altered waypoint altitudes

labels.name: dcs issue
labels.description: We think that this issue is a DCS World or a third party issue that cannot be resolved by us.

body:
B-17 flightplan defaults to about 9,000ft. In the Mission Editor I changed all waypoints to 20,000ft for a more realistic experience, and also changed the bombing action to "above 20,000ft" because otherwise the AI try dive-bombing and blow themselves up with their own bombs.

Upon flying the misison, B-17s flew their waypoints at the default 9,000ft, and then circled over the target area trying to gain 20,000ft before dropping their payload.

title: Invalid face handle error
body:
**Describe the bug**
When trying to press the take off button nothing happens on the main Window, but the console shows a "OSError: invalid face handle" error. Pressing the take off button a second time crashes the application

This issue happens most of the time for me, but not every time. In about 1 in 20 cases it procedes normally to the mission window

**To Reproduce**

2. Press the green take off button
3. Nothing happen on the main window
4. Checking the console it shows "OSError: invalid face handle"
5. pressing the take off button again crashes the application
**Expected behavior**
Pressing the take off button should lead normally to the next window
