title: Ground Units do not move correctly when set on Aggressive
body:
**Describe the bug**
Ground Units do not move forward when stance is set on Aggressive. Breakthrough appears to work fine. On the F10 map, they have a single waypoint a short distance behind them, although previously they had 3 waypoints (two forward, and one fallback waypoint).

**To Reproduce**
Set frontline ground units on Aggressive

This bug has appeared consistently on my end since at least #1065 (though it probably first occured a couple builds before that). It is still occuring on #1077.

**Expected behavior**
Ground units should move forward.

**Additional information**

The issue should be easily replicable, but if you'd like an example, grab the zip file I uploaded for https://github.com/Khopa/dcs_liberation/issues/793. The bug definitely exists on that turn.

**Version information (please complete the following information):**
Has occured from #1064 to #1077 but likely first occured a bit before that.

title: Hercules Issues (18JAN-2021)
body:
DCS Liberation Version: v2.4-1052-preview

Quick couple bug reports for the Hercules Plugin/Mod.

The most impactful bug so far is the Hercules_Cargo.lua being outdated and non-functional - this prevents deployments of any cargo or paratroopers from the C-130. Should be a simple fix, all that needs replacing is the Hercules_Cargo.lua file located in \dcs_liberation\resources\plugins\herculescargo . I've sent the replacement file in #bug-report channel in the Discord, but you can also DM me at Haydz#0444 on Discord if you want me to send the file directly that way.

The other (more minor) bug is the radio frequency that the Hercules is tuned to by default in DCS Liberation - it attempts a NATO UHF frequency, however the Hercules mod can only accept frequencies from 118 to 143 MHz AM. This is not a major issue as the Hercules mod currently has non-functioning radios, so players will be unable to send/receive transmissions from the aircraft anyway

title: DCS Lib 2.3.4 - Carrier / Tarawa missing from Desert War Campaign (Persian Gulf) - Bug or Feature?
body:
Went hunting for issues related to Carrier spawns, but could only find a suggestion for Carriers on all maps, so I'm posting this just in case it's a bug.

**Description**:
Noticed that a new Desert War campaign was not generating the carrier groups. Looks like the carrier spawns in the base desert_war.miz file have been replaced by speed boats. Not sure if this was done to remove carrier spawns from Desert War, or if its a bug.

**Steps to reproduce the behavior**:
1. Create a new Desert Campaign in DCS Lib 2.3.4
2. Enable Supercarrier / Or not(haven't tested this part)
3. Observe no carrier groups on Liberation campaign map, or in the mission editor when loading up next turn.

**Additional info**:
Using other .miz files as reference, swapped in the Stennis and Tarawa on the Speedboat units. After doing this, a new Desert War campaign generated the carrier groups and seems to be adding them to mission files correctly. Ran through the mission in DCS, everything seemed to function normally. TACAN and ICLS worked on the Carrier, and both Carrier and Tarawa were properly named.

**Information for debugging**:

- [DCSLibCarrierIssue.zip](https://github.com/Khopa/dcs_liberation/files/5826877/DCSLibCarrierIssue.zip)
- Above .zip contains original desert_war.miz (included with 2.3.4) and a modified version used for my testing purposes.

**Version information:**
 - DCS Liberation 2.3.4

**Additional context**
Nothing I can think of, but if any additional info or testing is needed, I'm standing by.

We flew multiplayer mission. When the last person leaves the server I stopped the mission. Then came to DCS Liberation window. Clicked on Accept. It showed what we killed for 2 seconds and then crashed. Then I reopened the same .liberation file and loaded the state.json again. None of the killed units were shown. Only 3 base capture events. title: [WW2]Cannot shoot down enemy planes
body:
**Describe the bug**
For the life of me, I can't shoot down enemy planes unless I manage to put their engine on fire. They end up flying very slowly, their propellers hardly spinning, sometime one wheel down, sometime inverted (as if the pilot was trying to bail out?). No matter how may .50 rounds I put on them, even if I go back to base, rearm and repeat.
AI wingman can indeed down them but I can't.

**Expected behavior**
Enemy fighters should crash to the ground singing the nazi party anthem.

**Additional information**
None that I can think of. Maybe I should record a video?

**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - DCS Liberation 2.3.5

**Additional context**
Could possibly be an issue with the new damage model? But in Instant Action I can down them pretty easily (tested against Kurst, Dora and Anton)

title: Tankers are flying too fast for the A-10
body:
While we have multiple requests to overhaul tankers in Liberation ( [example 1](https://github.com/Khopa/dcs_liberation/issues/468), [example 2](https://github.com/Khopa/dcs_liberation/issues/288) ), I would like to isolate one particular problem: the tanker's speed.

Currently, all boom tankers in Liberation are flying at their default speed of 330 kts. Which renders them useless for slower aircraft (namely, the A-10C & A-10C II).

Reducing their speed to something in the area of 230 kts should solve this issue without any visible consequences. And this fix is much simpler than adding a separate "slow" tanker or completing the aforementioned overhaul requests 😉

title: Liveries for DCS modules only from DCS install, not saved games
body:
.**Describe the bug**
When creating custom liveries for factions, Liberation successfully inserts skins for aircraft such as the AH-1W, MiG-23, IL-78 without any issues from the Saved Games\DCS\Liveries folder. For aircraft that are DCS Modules however, such as the F-16, MiG-19, and so on will not work, even though they can be seen in the Mission Editor. If the skins are placed in the Liveries folder in the DCS Mods folders, they work fine.

**To Reproduce**
1. Add skin to liveries folder in Saved Games\DCS\Liveries
2. Select the skin in DCS Mission Editor to check it’s ok
3. Edit a faction and enter the skin for the aircraft
4. Create mission in liberation with specified aircraft
5. Skin will not be present when flown
6. Add skin to liveries folder in DCS\Mods\aircraft\etc... 
7. create mission in liberation with specified aircraft
8. Skin will now work when flown

**Expected behavior**
Unsure if this is a liberation issue, or something within DCS, but if the skin can be seen in the ME, I’d expect it to be usable in liberation.

title: Destroyed/Dead Runways Still Registered As Operational
body:
Before filing, please search the issue tracker to see if the issue has already been reported.

**Describe the bug**

Runway is destroyed (= dead event) in mission.

``state.json`` also registers death of airbase.

But Liberation does not -- runway is still operational.

**To Reproduce**

(1) Generate a Liberation mission, with (player) assigned OCA strike. Loadout requires > 6000lb of iron bombs, or probably better at least 1x GBU-31(V)4B. Here I used King Hussein College as target. Not sure if other airbases will work or not work yet.
(2) For testing purposes, I removed all RED and BLUE groups except player a/c.
(3) Deliver ordnance.
(4) Watch ordnance hit.
(5) See "dead" event in briefing.
(6) Exit mission.
(7) Accept results in Liberation.

Note that:

(a) ``state.json`` correctly registers the airfield as destroyed, twice under "killed_ground_units" and twice under "destroyed_ground objects".
(b) Yet Liberation incorrectly does not recognize anything destroyed or lost, and declares the runway still operational.

**Expected behavior**

Liberation should declare runway as inoperational.

**Additional information**

We will usually need more information for debugging. Include as much of the following as you are able:

- DCS Liberation save file (the `.liberation` file you save from the DCS Liberation window). By default these are located in your DCS saved games directory (`%USERPROFILE%/Saved Games/DCS`).
- The generated mission file (the `.miz` file that you load in DCS to play the turn). By default these are located in your missions directory (`%USERPROFILE%/Saved Games/DCS/Missions`).
- A tacview track file, especially when demonstrating an issue with AI behavior. By default these are locaed in your Tacview tracks directory (`%USERPROFILE%/Documents/Tacview`).

**Version information (please complete the following information):**

 - DCS Liberation [e.g. 2.3.1]: e174c1b (build #956)

**Additional context**

Maybe there is a disconnect between the airfield name in DCS vs Liberation's internal database? I recall that a recent patch in DCS may have changed a number of airfield names.

[rwy1.zip](https://github.com/Khopa/dcs_liberation/files/5780479/rwy1.zip)

title: Disabling AI planes parking start does not effect friendly planes.
body:
**Describe the bug**
Friendly planes are starting from ramp when `AI planes parking start (AI starts in flight if disabled)` is disabled.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create Syrian Civil War Campaign (USA 2005, Libya 2011)
2. Disable `AI planes parking start (AI starts in flight if disabled)`
3. Load up `Bassel Al` with F16s and F18s
4. Have player flight _not_ at `Bassel Al`
5. Make all packages TOT's `ASAP`
6. Watch traffic at `Bassel Al`

**Expected behavior**

- Friendly planes should start in air instead of at ramp when disabling `AI planes parking start (AI starts in flight if disabled)`
- When `AI planes parking start (AI starts in flight if disabled)` is enabled, planes shouldn't be taxiing into each other.

**Additional information**

Ran into this on the first mission of a campaign:
![Standoff](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74509817/103724202-0654b900-4f91-11eb-9433-c7f09198e06f.png)

With `AI planes parking start (AI starts in flight if disabled)` **enabled** planes were taxiing to block each other.  So I disabled  `AI planes parking start (AI starts in flight if disabled)` and planes are still using `Takeoff From Ramp`, leading to this situation.

Tacview, Campaign, and Mission:
[Standoff.zip](https://github.com/Khopa/dcs_liberation/files/5773744/Standoff_2.zip)

**Version information**
 - DCS Liberation 2.3.4

title: Wind direction on DCS Liberation menu bar is depicted incorectly
body:
![lib winds](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39744809/103261867-ddf90900-4957-11eb-8d08-905cf6139695.PNG)
![mission editor wind](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39744809/103261874-e7827100-4957-11eb-972e-8635fb43bbed.PNG)

Before filing, please search the issue tracker to see if the issue has already been reported.

**Describe the bug**
Wind should be depicted as wind from a direction, not wind to a direction. 353 degrees at 2 knots is wind from the north, not wind blowing to the north. This would be in line with the way aviation weather reports describe wind direction

DCS mission editor describes wind in the same weird way.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/METAR#International_METAR_codes

title: re-initializing the turn cancels all outstanding orders with no refunds
body:
`Game.initialize_turn` deletes all the events for the turn. Some of those events are the front line conflicts (which are intended to be reset), but it also includes the purchase events for the turn. Clearing that list removes all the outstanding purchase orders for both factions with no refunds.

This only gets called in three places:

1. At the end of the turn. Orders aren't removed before they're delivered, so no problem here.
2. When cheating to capture a base.
3. When cheating a front-line forward or backward.

We should split the unit delivery events and the conflict events into separate lists (there's very little reason for the types to be shared anyway) so we can regenerate the front line data without having to clear the outstanding orders.

title: FOB structures shouldn't be picked as targets by the auto-planner
body: FOB structures are implemented as `BuildingGroundObject` so they show up in the list of TGOs that the ground planner considers. We shouldn't be picking those as targets.

title: don't count FOB structures for income
body: The buildings that make up the FOB grant income like a strike target, and the FOB itself also grants income. Should stop granting the income for the structure itself.

title: refund deliveries that were canceled because of a capture
body:
If the player cheats to capture bases on turn 0 the pending AI deliveries to that base vanish with no refund. This leaves the AI pretty broken since it will usually take several turns to recoup that loss.

Same problem exists on other turns, and I think also happens for a normal capture.

title: Disbanding base defence group and closing window results in the removal of that base defence slot
body:
**Describe the bug**
If you disband a base defence group, and then close the unit window and the control point window, then re-open the control point window, that unit group no longer appears under the base defences tab. Basically, you lose that base defence slot permanently.

**Expected behavior**
I expect to see a "Manage" button, which would allow me to buy a unit group for that slot.

Liberation #909

title: Channel Map performance
body:
I get good performance on the Channel Map without running DCS Liberation, but with Liberation running the Dunkirk mission and relatively few units, I get 7~10 frames per second. Comparatively, a much more complex scenario with way more units in Syria runs fairly well for me.

Can anyone confirm whether this is a Liberation issue or a Channel map issue?

title: Planes not landing on Supercarrier?
body:
**Describe the bug**
Planes that take off from the Supercarrier module do not appear to be landing on it and ejecting instead.  This might be a DCS bug?

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Generate a mission with 12+ F-A/18Cs launching from the Supercarrier.
2. Play the mission (I also used Combined Arms after I had returned to the carrier)
3. Watch almost every aircraft eject after running out of fuel (presumably).

**Expected behavior**
Planes that launch from the supercarrier, land on the supercarrier, and don't eject.

**Additional information**

Campaign/Mission/Track/Tacview here:
(File hosted by WeTransfer, I know the link looks sketchy AF but I've successfully used the service in the past, only in the email delivery though, not in the "get a link" form.)
https://we.tl/t-8ARJZ1lcTy


**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - DCS Liberation 2.3.2

**Additional context**
I told my wingman to RTB when they reached bingo status.  They flew around then ejected when running out of fuel.
I was using Combined Arms / Controlling units after I had landed.

title: Some new game actions happen before group generation
body:
The groups in TGOs are generated *after* the game is created so any new-game tasks like planning the first turn's purchases or setting up threat zones are done inaccurately:

* SAMs don't have SAMs yet so have no threat zone
* Carriers have no carrier yet so can't get aircraft

We should either move the group generation earlier or move the new-game stuff later.

title: Scud sites are considered air defense for threat mapping
body:
Before filing, please search the issue tracker to see if the issue has already been reported.

**Describe the bug**
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Generate a campaign with SCUD sites and scuds in faction.  Syrian Civil War, USA 2005 vs Syria 2011
2. Click on Next Turn
3. Scud missile sites are given a 172 nm threat range as an air defense.


**Expected behavior**
Scud Missiles should not be considered an air defense

**Additional information**

This is probably a two part bug;
First, missile sites should be given a distinct category from AA as a TGO
https://github.com/Khopa/dcs_liberation/blob/98ac4bd5c88b7090fc519da7a411d917b29d66f7/game/theater/theatergroundobject.py#L267

Second, we should filter for only Air Defense TGOs when calculating air defense threat ranges:
https://github.com/Khopa/dcs_liberation/blob/98ac4bd5c88b7090fc519da7a411d917b29d66f7/game/threatzones.py#L97

title: Huey spawning with low ammo?
body:
Might fall under an enhancement but it seems to fall under a bug description as well.

**Describe the bug**
Without a custom loadout, various airplanes and helicopters come with either an excessive loadout (F/A-18C has missiles stacked to the brim), an odd loadout (A10-C II carrying only double rack 9Ms), or a partial ammo count (UH-1H with 300 bullets in each minigun but side gunner with full ammo), instead of an entirely blank loadout like they should have upon joining the mission.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create flight and edit it with desired waypoints/tasks
2. Do not set a custom loadout
3. Take-off and load mission (either SP or MP)
4. Load into F/A-18 or other plane and observe loadout not being blank.

**Expected behavior**
Loading into an empty airship or rotor craft. 

We will usually need more information for debugging. Include as much of the following as you are able:


- DCS Liberation save file (the `.liberation` file you save from the DCS Liberation window). By default these are located in your DCS saved games directory (`%USERPROFILE%/Saved Games/DCS`).
[Test Mission 2.zip](https://github.com/Khopa/dcs_liberation/files/5742248/Test.Mission.2.zip)

- The generated mission file (the `.miz` file that you load in DCS to play the turn). By default these are located in your missions directory (`%USERPROFILE%/Saved Games/DCS/Missions`).
[liberation_nextturn.zip](https://github.com/Khopa/dcs_liberation/files/5742249/liberation_nextturn.zip)


**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - 2.3.2

title: Actions with long names truncate kneeboard info pages
body:
Thanks very much for all the work with Liberation, it's great and given a huge new lease on life with DCS.

I've noticed in my campaign that very long action names, like with this example;

![page00](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16272847/103061768-46fd1b80-45fc-11eb-9b23-1a3f5c445da2.png)

Result in the Flight Plan table being truncated, and therefore missing critical information such as the arrival/departure times.  They probably simply need the table to have that column trimmed if it's over a certain number of characters.

title: SAM Launcher spawned in middle of runway.
body:
I have searched the issue tracker to check if this issue has already been reported.

Describe the bug
    A SAM unit has been placed on the runway center-line at Incirlik.  This might be preventing AI flights from taking off.

To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

    Create Syria - Full Map Campaign (USA 2005, Libya 2011)
    Add some F-18s, A-10s, and F-16s at Incirlik to use for your first playable turn.
    Make first player flight a F-16 BARCAP with Warm Start.

    Runways and taxiways are clear of friendly ground unit obstructions.  AI flights taxi and takeoff on runways.

Version information (please complete the following information):

Additional Context

    When manually moving the ground units off the runway, AI flights taxi an use the runway.

title: Flight Radio is same as a ADF frequency.
body:
- I have searched the issue tracker to check if this issue has already been reported.

**Describe the bug**
VHF radio for the F16 will be tuned to the flight on warm start, however you will also be listening to an (what I think is) ADF/VOR pattern in the form of static.
If you change VHF to something else you will no longer hear static.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create Syria - Full Map Campaign (USA 2005, Libya 2011)
2. Add some F-18s, A-10s, and F-16s at Incirlik to use for your first playable turn.
3. Make first player flight a F-16 BARCAP with Warm Start.

**Expected behavior**
Radio frequencies that are used by the player in missions  (Flight, ATC, AWACS, Tankers) should not be the same as navigation aid frequencies (ADF, ILS, etc).

**Additional information**

We will usually need more information for debugging. Include as much of the following as you are able:

Campaign and mission:
[Radio_ADF.zip](https://github.com/Khopa/dcs_liberation/files/5719976/Radio_ADF.zip)

**Version information (please complete the following information):**
 - DCS Liberation 2.3.1

**Additional context**
I have seen this in other missions on Persian Gulf as well.  Unfortunately I didn't save them.

title: Culling not effective (2.3.1)
body:
**Describe the bug**
When enabling culling on Syria Full Map Campaign Default Culling option causes nothing to be culled and thus negating the usefulness of this feature

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Start a new Campaign (Blufor Cold War vs Russia 1970 Limited Air, super carrier enabled)
Enable Culling.
Pass Turn so first wave of purchases are made.

**Expected behavior**
Units far from the front line shall be culled. I note that the updated wiki says mission targets shall not be culled but presume that is only if there is a package assigned to them. As it is, the AI buys aircraft all over the place and thus massively extends the culling exclusion zones. which adds in all the ground units around them,

**Additional information**

We will usually need more information for debugging. Include as much of the following as you are able:

[liberation_nextturn.zip](https://github.com/Khopa/dcs_liberation/files/5719332/liberation_nextturn.zip)

title: Units don't always progress after a capture event.
body:
In two different campaigns (Invasion of Iran and Inherent Resolve) a base capture doesn't move the ground forces to the next airbase in the line, and leaves them at previous airfield in the line.  This requires purchasing new ground units and selling the old ones, and leaves the newly captured base defenseless until new ground units are purchased.  When this scenario happens, the tankers don't advance to the most recently captured airfield as well.

The only thing I can think that's common between these two cases are that I purchased air + ground units at the last friendly airfield in the same turn as I capture the next one.

I have a before/after campaign/states if needed.

title: Bug Report (Dev Build 411)
body:
Gave the latest dev build (Build 411 at the time) a test and I have some bug reports and observations:

1. Toggling culling zones on will hide all the units on the liberation map and just display a blank map

2. Ships no longer display their SAM ranges even when all the other SAM ranges are displayed

3. An empty ship objective (CAIMAN) is generated

4. A ship objective is generated on land (PYTHON) in the Liberation map but it is properly placed on water in the ME

5. Egress points for the planned anti-ship strikes take them directly over enemy SAM sites

6. The F-15C can be fragged for an anti-ship strike in Liberation but it will default to CAS in the ME (presumably other aircraft that are pure A2A will have this same problem)

7. Single flight anti-ship strikes still get generated with join and split points

title: client slots not used when each flight has only one slot
body: If a multiplayer mission is set up such that there are multiple client slots, _flights_ with only one client slot still get set as "Player". This breaks thing in DCS.

title: Buildings Often Too Close Together - Collision Volumes Shielding Each Other From Damage Even When Destroyed
body:
This is partly a DCS issue - Buildings set too close together, even when visually distinct, can block damage and bomb impacts with their collision volumes even when destroyed. This means one building, even when "dead", can block bomb hits and damage (as far as I can tell). This renders neighboring buildings invulnerable to bombs dropped from certain directions unless they are at very steep angles.

Even "dead" buildings have collision volumes that will absorb bomb hits.

A possible work-around in Liberation would be to space the structures a few meters further apart. Even 2-5 meters of additional spacing could make a difference.

title: Strike flights don't attack as a group, only attacking first target
body:
Also only the first aircraft of an formation is dropping its bombs.

_Originally posted by @zelosos in https://github.com/Khopa/dcs_liberation/issues/235#issuecomment-715218025_

title: Strikes attack dead buildings
body: I'm noticing that AI aircraft are attacking just a single point on strike missions, even if there is a dead target or no target at that point. Let's say there are three APCs, at waypoints 3, 4, and 5. The AI flight will drop all their ordnance on waypoint 3, even if the vehicle there is already completely 100% dead (it might have been killed that mission or on a previous mission). Even on subsequent returns to the same target on later missions, they will still bomb that same wreck on that same site, leaving the rest alone.

title: Bug: ATC Call Sign the same for all players in MP
body:
When using ATC (i.e. CASE III) in multiplayer, if one person calls "Inbound" the other person cannot make independent calls.

Looking in the Mission Editor, it appears that all units have the same tail number - 010.  I will try changing this in the ME next time, but it would be good if when the flight is set up, confirm or configure different tail numbers for client flights.

title: Unprovoked crashing issue
body: My friend and I have been enjoying Liberation 2.0 recently when suddenly i could not load our campaign any more or load new campaigns. I'll happily upload anything that you need in order to see what the issue is.

title: Syria MAP: Ground Units spawn on roftops
body:
As the title says ... many Units are spawning very close to Buildings and sometimes on their roftops.....
This makes it very hard to spot especialy if they spawn between the half round hothouses.

title: Glowing vehicles

labels.name: dcs issue
labels.description: We think that this issue is a DCS World or a third party issue that cannot be resolved by us.

body:
I noticed moving vehicles have an orange hue around them, similar to the glow effect around burning wreckages. This is especially apparent at night, which makes it super easy to spot marching vehicles.
The effect disappears when the vehicle stops, or goes through water. 

If I place these units in the mission editor and have them drive around they do not glow. Also, if I load the liberation_nextturn.miz file, without the mainframe running in the background, the moving units do not glow at all. This leads me to believe, the glow effect is somehow caused by a DCS Liberation 2.0 script.
Could you please look into this? 

I made some screenshots.

Abrams' and Bradleys on the move:
https://photos.app.goo.gl/5fqdpczcsjuBDedK6

BTR glowing before being hit:
https://photos.app.goo.gl/BbVwr2AxtzvEVut67

Abrams tanks standing still:
https://photos.app.goo.gl/pCEETvjSTQ6nFhv59

title: Recenter map when loading game
body:
The Nevada map can be zoomed out far further than it is drawn, and scrolled in several directions until it is completely off the page. When I started a new game on it, the default view contained nothing but empty space. 

![Capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19675397/90866135-0ee98180-e359-11ea-86e7-683cdfde22fc.JPG)

title: Map projection is imperfect
body:
Many of the airbases on the Invasion of Iran map are located incorrectly. 

Bandar Abbas, Havadarya, Qeshm Island, and Shiraz are all too far north, while Khasab is too far west. 

It looks like it may effect satellite units as well, as several naval units are being drawn on land. 

![Capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19675397/90865643-486dbd00-e358-11ea-8e40-abf976e1fb40.JPG)

title: Bug: AI Helicopters missing payloads
body:
I have noticed that certain unflyable helicopters (AH-64A, AH-64D, Mi-24V, Mi-28N) are missing a loadout of missiles/rockets during missions. I can happily add a loadout to my own flights through the mission planner, but obviously the enemy attack helicopters cannot, and that makes them a little less threatening than they should be haha.

Looking through the customized_payloads folder, I notice those helicopters haven't got a loadout defined.

My thanks to you for all your dedication and hard work for this amazing addition to DCS!

title: Reinforcements captured following loss of a base
body:
After managing to capture a base in Caucasus, a lot of my ground and air units were destroyed.  as a result I planned a substantial reinforcement for the next turn.  Unfortunately, I lost the base during the current turn.  My planned reinforcements went into a twilight zone and re-appeared in the RED team on the following turn!  All of the sudden, I was facing F/A-18C airplanes Leopard II tanks!!

From a realism perspective, this would be very unlikely as there is substantial training and logistics requirement to operate modern weapon systems.  The enemy would definitely study the captured units for weaknesses but operating the equipment is a different ballgame.  Also, from a gameplay perspective, why a reinforcement would be sent to a captured base?  As soon as the situation would deteriorate, the assets would not be sent there in the middle of a fight unless there are crewed battle-ready units.

I suggest that when player reinforcement are planned for a base that is not longer on the player side, the money should come back for the following turn.

Many Thank for an outstanding campaign engine!

WipeUout

title: Version 10, Missing units after turn ?
body:
I have just upgraded from vs9 to vs10, great improvements thank you.
Started a new campaign, took my first turn (turn 2). During this I used Combined Arms and moved my ground troops forward destroying enemy vehicles and Sam sites. Ended my turn and saw the report, lost planes and 2 ground units which were destroyed under my control during the push. When I came to play turn 3 the only ground vehicles I had listed and visible in the mission editor were ones I had not moved all others were missing (which had not been stated destroyed in the end of turn report) also some of the Sam sites I had destroyed had respawned but with different Sam systems. 
I am going to play another round to see if this occurs again. I did not have this happening in version 9
Lisa

title: AI flights crash
body:
AI flights do not RTB when they are running low on fuel/run out of proper weapons. They keep engaging enemies until they crash, also the pilots never eject.

Example 1:
Pair of F-15Cs on CAP move in to engage enemy fighters, drop the fuel tanks during BFM. Shoot down all bandits, then go back to continue original flight path. If an enemy air asset spawns in the meantime they turn back to engage until they run dry. If they do not have missiles, they go in for a dog fight.

Example 2:
A-10s on CAS mission never give up, they keep engaging enemies until the last bullet in the 30 mm. They last longer than the F-15s, but I have infantry enabled, so they go after each and every foot soldier until they loose all fuel and crash. 

Edit: I understand this issue is likely caused by DCS AI being inconsiderate of fuel levels, so I suggest giving AI flights unlimited fuel, if possible and there is no other solution. It is rather annoying that I have to waste money on restocking flights, because they were stupid and let themselves run dry.
